deck_excerpt: Scrap Orcust post 14.09.2020 banlist. Handtrap-heavy.
deck_description: As Jet-Synchron and O-Lion got banned, Orcust now has to rely on Crystron Rosenix for the first extender off Scrap Recycler, with Called by the Grave being limited, this combo is extremely fragile against hantraps, especially Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring and D.D. Crow. Since I do not like luck factors, I've decided to not have Called by the Grave as a weird One-Of in this list and simply do not play it for the time being, instead I've decided to up the number of handtraps from Six to Ten, this way opening one handtrap is basically guaranteed and opening two is probable. I've also cut out Machina Fortress for the standard Danger!-package, as by being Dark attribute, they help making The Phantom Knights of Rusty Bardiche and gain more advantage by drawing a card when accordingly triggered. With Bardiche obviously also comes The Phantom Knights of Silent Boots and two The Phantom Knight's Fog Blade. You could also play The Phantom Knights of Ancient Cloak and The Phantom Knight's Rank-Up Magic Launch to summon VFD over a Dingirsu if you want to play more of a blowout. This list also uses the Gadget-Combo for optimizing any hand with 2+ Starters with the exception of only drawing multiple Girsu The Orcust Mekk-Knight and no Scrap Recyclers, as Girsu has a hard OTP condition.  If uninterrupted, this decks optimized combo ends on four Apollousa negates, two set Fog Blades, a quick effect non-targeting spin trough Lib and I:P Masquerena, a quick effect non-targeting send trough the Dingirsu + Babel + Cymbal Skeleton setup and interruptions trough any handtraps you might have available.  Enjoy playing.

deck_excerpt: An oldie but a goodie, Evilswarms work as a fun control and lockdown deck that has prevalant plays going first AND second.
deck_description:
Evilswarm is past its prime, but that doesnt mean it can't make plays in todays game. Remember, Savage Dragon and other high level monsters still see play, so Evilswarms can at the very least put a dent in certain strategies.

Deck techs

  • Crusadia Reclusia: Special summon this card to Steelswarm Origins link point, destroying it and a monster your opponent controls, triggering Origins effect and summoning 2 Evilswarms from the deck for an instant rank 4.
  • Iron Dragon Tiamaton: This combo's so well with Origin, acting like a psueudo extra deck lock in some sense. If there are 3 cards in either extra monster column (second left and second right) while Steelswarm Origin is in that column, special summon Tiamaton under Origin, and Origin's effect to be immune to destruction while linked will prevent it from being destroyed by Tiamaton. Origin's evvect already limited the ability to summon from the extra deck, limiting players to its link arrows only, but now that column can't be used, that renders the extra deck inaccessible.

deck_excerpt: "Control" Plunder Patroll
deck_description: Since "Called by the Grave" is banned, I feel like the combo heavy version of Plunder is not consistent enough, so here is my version of a blind going second Plunder Patrol deck.  Your main focus is breaking the board with your Handtraps, evenly matched, and so on and summon your needed ship in your opponent's turn. You can also use the White Aura whale to nuke the board, also you can chainblock its effect with the graveyard effect of blue or whitebeard.  If you want u can switch Pride of Plunder Patrol and Ghost ogre for 3x desires and 2x Silent angler to get more combo options.  The side options are for special cases like Dragoon, the kaijus, in general, are really good at Plunder because they can give you access to your ships/ GHostbelle and cosmic cyclone are for GY reliant decks or backrow decks.     Feel free to comment and improve the deck or to tell me if its good or not Pride of Plunder Patrol seems not that great but if u have it in hand and you are able to break the opponent's board, which should be possible in most of the cases, you can send it to the GY and send one Monster of their extra deck to the GY as well, so they cant combo again.

deck_excerpt: Harpie Ladies are hawt. Infinite Negates or Barrier stun, + a good grind game, and some truly unbeatable set-ups.
deck_description: Harpie Lady deck. I think Elegant Egotist and Harpie's Feather Storm are the best cards so I built around them. Sidedeck plan includes a way to out Forbidden Droplets and Dark Ruler No Mores going first, by making Wynn the Wind Charmer and drawing 1 of 6 cards. Neither are perfect answers but I like it.  Remembered Imperial Order exists, so it got added to the anti-spell package. It's worse in some situations against Forbidden Droplet, but better when seen alongside Feather Storm, (because it leaves Harpie Lady on the field) and it doesn't need to use up the Linkuriboh if you don't have an extender. You can activate it at Spell Speed 2 before Dark Ruler No More, or in response to a Forbidden Droplet that didn't discard a trap, but mostly it is here to preserve Linkuriboh.  2 Harpies = Infinite Negates. Channeler adds Abyss Dweller or Cyber Slash Harpie into the mix. You can summon Barrier Statue game 2, or use Barrier Statue with Gizmek Uka, when you see combos that incorporate Martial Metalmarcher, Dragunity Romulus, or other wind bricks (Barrier Statue can even be made into Simorgh, opening up combo plays from this)  I'm onto Secret Village of the Spellcaster over other spell negation options now, because while it is vulnerable to random Magicians' Souls and Spellcaster archetypes (like Pendulums), it is still generally better than the other options against Dark Ruler No More and Forbidden Droplet. Since Simorgh can't be targeted by Impermance, Feather Storm protects from all generic hand traps, and your end boards are generally going to be either infinite negates or a Barrier Statue + Bagooska, this tech eliminates the remaining options to out you besides Sphere Mode (the big normal summon Kaiju. I'm glad a God Card is playable). Yes, this does require seeing the right specific cards for the counters your opponents has, but I just really like "unbreakable" locks.

deck_excerpt: Gouki Infernoble Warrior Synchro Turbo 2020 (Going First or Second but prefers to go First)
deck_description: Alright so after testing this deck for a while I came up with these insane combos with Gouki and the Synchro engine. You guys thought Gouki was dead? Hell no. I've made this deck almost unbrickable plus the combos are ridiculous. The deck always wants to go first and if you go first you will most likely win unless you get handtrapped more than twice but the deck can go second because maining Dark Ruler is really good (trust me). I figured out how to "bypass" the banlist for the synchro turbo engine. Plaguespreader Zombie does the job perfectly. As well as Mecha Phantom Beast Warbluran. I also came up with using Attack Gainer. This card is so good. Going second it makes your opponent constantly lose attack during your combos to allow for an easier OTK and since it is earth it can be used for Naturia Beast with Gouki Suprex. Two Gouki monsters + any other warrior is full combo. Two warrior monsters is full synchro combo. Heritage of The Chalice is full synchro combo and possibly full combo in general depending on your hand because you add Durendal, then equip it to any warrior and search Fire Flint Lady which gives you two warrior monsters. I will now explain full combo... First you want to have three (two works too, this is just the full power combo) warrior monsters, two Gouki monsters + any other warrior extender work best. Normal summon the Gouki monster then if its Suprex special summon another Gouki from your hand and use the other warrior extender. Go into Isolde using one Gouki and the warrior extender. Isolde chain 1, Gouki chain 2 (to chainblock ash and ogre). Gouki adds Headbatt and Isolde adds Riscorpio. Headbatt activates to send Riscorpio to summon itself targeting the other Gouki on the field. Isolde effect to send Divine Sword to summon Attack Gainer. Isolde into Linkross. Linkross summons two tokens, Attack Gainer + 1 token into Formula Synchron. Formula with other token to make Metal Marcher. Metal Marcher summon Attack Gainer (only if Suprex is in grave, if not then summon Formula). Then Marcher and Linkross into Haqlifibrax. Effect to summon Plaguespreader. Plaguespreader + Headbatt into Herald of The Arc Light. Headbatt effect to search Rematch. Use Rematch to summon Suprex and any other Gouki (Headbatt for this example). Suprex + Attack Gainer into Nat Beast. Use Plaguespreader in grave, summon itself, Plaguespreader + Headbatt + Halqifibrax into Apollousa. I'm pretty sure your opponent won't be able to get over that... Also you can make Borreload Savage Dragon by making Auroradon with Formula Synchron + Haqlifibrax and then the two Phantom Beast tokens (without Nat Beast on the field) by using Auroradon to tribute himself and Plaguespreader (that was summoned from thee grave via its own effect) to summon Warbluran and use his effect to tribute a token to make him level two. Then Warbluran plus the other two tokens is Borreload Savage! Theres so many combinations and end boards with this deck its crazy. I hope you guys enjoyed and stick around for more awesome decks by yours truly.

deck_excerpt: Adrian Gecko's Cloudian deck from yu-gi-oh Gx
deck_description: This archetype was used by Adrian Gecko in yu-gi-oh Gx. Use cloudian aerosol to summon Eye of the Typhoon. Repeat twice for massive anti-damage wall of supersized beatsticks. For this, discard smoke ball any chance you get when you use aerosol. Use Poison Cloud for extra damage. After aerosol combo, summon cirrostratus and natural disaster for huge effect damage. Always make sure to play this combo when you can, ok?

deck_excerpt: Zombie control deck, with a basic combo.
deck_description:
No Dragoon, i feel like for the zombie strategy depending on 2 garnes and anaconda taking a spot actually hurts the deck. Its standard, super poly, rivalry and artifact sactuary, you want to go first with this deck. Danger pack, 2 Jack o Bolan, if not you can change those for hand traps like ash, veiler or gamma.   Posible plays:
  1. Start with Mezuki(or Necro Banshee)), Jack o Bolan and Uni zombie, jack o bolan offers a special summon and a discard for cost, very useful to send another zombie monster to grave, uni zombies sends mezuki to grave(if only banshee was sent or if you already have zombie world on field, use Jack and Uni to link for Halquifibrax, summon Glow up Bulb, use mezuki or revive the jack o Bolan, link summon Union Carrier, Doomking lands from the effect of Bulb, equip the buster sword from union carriers effect and usually you should be able to also put 1 or 2 cards facedown, posibly being, artifact sanctum rivalry of the warlords or SuperPoly. If zombie world is destroyed, you can trigger jack o bolan to chain with doomkin to do at least 1 interuption of banishing.
  2. Standard play: Danger in Hand + Uni Zombie or Shiranui Solitaire, Danger discards to draw, you play your starter, get zombie world to field and combo off to end on Union Carrier.
  3. Bad Hand: The worst hand would be to no draw any starter, but if you get a super poly and a artifact sanctum, you should be ok.

deck_excerpt: DM IS BACK BABY
deck_description: So with the release of Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon, I decided that I can kind of rework the deck. I am a fan of the og anime and still like to play DM decks every now and then. This is nothing super gonna destroy the meta or anything but it is competitive in my eyes. The first thing your all wondering is why there is The Eye of Timaeus. My theory on that is if DM reaches the field you can just activate it and have Dragoon out for free basically. Also, another plus in this variation is that Red-Eyes Black Dragon isn't as much of a brick because of the fusion spell, Secrets of Dark Magic.

deck_excerpt: A combo deck that summons Arcana Force XXI - The World from Isolde, and uses its effect each turn with Guardragon Pisty and Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dr
deck_description: This is a meta-competitive combo deck that summons Arcana Force XXI - The World from Isolde, and uses its effect each turn with Guardragon Pisty and Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon to prevent your opponent from having a turn. The combo: -Summon Isolde. Use its effect to search any Warrior. -Use Isolde's other effect to mill 4 equip spells (Except D.D.R., including Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade and Cursed Bamboo Sword if possible) and summon Armageddon Knight from your Deck (If Armageddon Knight or Plaguespreader Zombie is in your hand, get Dark Grepher instead). -Add Broken Bamboo Sword to your hand with Cursed Bamboo Sword's effect, and mill Plaguespreader Zombie with Armageddon Knight (Or Dark Grepher). -Put any dead draw you got on top of the deck (Or the warrior you got with Isolde's effect, if you don't have any) on top of your deck to Summon Plaguespreader. -Summon Halqifibrax with Isolde and Plaguespreader. Use its effect to summon Vylon Cube. -Use Vylon Cube and Armageddon Knight to summon Shooting Riser Dragon. Use Cube's effect to search D.D.R., and Shooting Riser Dragon's to mill a level 3 Warrior. -Banish Isolde and Armageddon Knight from the GY to add Phoenix Blade from your GY to your hand. -Activate D.D.R., discarding Phoenix Blade to Summon Armageddon Knight. Use its effect to mill Summoner Monk. -Summon Dugares the Timeless using Shooting Riser Dragon and Armageddon Knight. Use its effect to summon Summoner Monk. -Use Summoner Monk's effect to summon Planet Pathfinder, discarding Broken Bamboo Sword. Tribute Pathfinder to search Light Barrier. Activate it. -Use Summoner Monk and Halqifibrax to summon Selene, Queen of the Master Magicians. Use Selene's effect to revive Summoner Monk. -(Optional): Use any 2 monsters you control, except Selene and Summoner Monk, to summon Knightmare Cerberus or Phoenix, so it is co-linked to Selene. Use its effect. -Add Phoenix Blade from your GY to your hand, by banishing any 2 Warriors. -Use Summoner Monk's effect to summon Rescue Ferret, discarding Phoenix Blade. -Use Selene and Summoner Monk to summon Apollousa, Bow of the Goddess. -Shuffle Rescue Ferret into the Deck to Summon Black Metal Dragon, any level 1 (except Brotaur), and any level 4, to the zones Apollousa points to. -Use the monsters you summoned, except Black Metal Dragon, to Summon Artifact Dagda. -Summon Guardragon Elpy using Black Metal Dragon, and use Black Metal Dragon's effect to search Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon. -Use Elpy's effect to summon Omni Dragon Brotaur. Use Brotaur's effect targeting Dagda, to search Arcana Force XXI - The World. -Use Elpy, Dugares, and Artifact Dagda to summon Saryuja Skull Dread. -Use Saryuja's effect to summon The World from your hand. Choose Heads with Light Barrier's effect. -Summon Guardragon Pisty using Brotaur. -Use Pisty's effect to summon Brotaur or Black Metal Dragon, banish it to summon Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon, and use REDMD's effect to summon Brotaur or Black Metal Dragon (Whichever one is still in the GY). -During the End Phase, use The World's effect to send REDMD and the monster summoned by its effect to the GY to skip your opponent's next turn. -Repeat the last 2 steps as many times as you need to to win. Deck Breakdown: Main Deck: -Reinforcement of the Army--"Infernoble Arms - Durendal": These cards focus on getting Isolde up as consistently as possible. I included 3 Neo-Spacian Aqua Dolphins because you will want to use its effect as much as possible, to remove any hand traps your opponent may have, and it can make Isolde with any warrior that can be Special Summoned. -Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade--Arcana Force XXI - The World: These cards are part of the main combo, as detailed above. -Called by the Grave--Ash Blossom: These cards are used to counter anything that might threaten the combo.  They can be changed out based on the current meta & personal budget. Extra Deck: -Invoked Raidjin: This is the best Warrior I could find that can be summoned with Instant Fusion., with the ability to flip an opponent's monster face-down. -Millennium-Eyes Restrict: If you have Instant Fusion but you can summon Isolde without it, use it to summon this card instead. You never have 5 main monster zones taken up at a time, so you can use this card to protect your entire combo. Can be replaced with something that is useful in more duels. -Everything else: These cards are part of the combo. I have a second Isolde in case the first one gets negated. Side deck: These cards are useful against a variety of decks, and can be switched based on the meta & your budget. More info on them below. Support Cards: -Called by the Grave: Useful against Ash Blossom and Effect Veiler. -Prohibition: This card can stop any specific card that poses a threat to the combo, unless it is already on the field. -Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring: Good for stopping other combo decks, or Gamma. Will also be good to have when/if we get Crossout Designator. -PSY-Framegear Gamma: Good for stopping an opponent's combo, or to stop Eldlich from being summoned. -Dark Ruler No More: Shuts down combo decks, but relatively ineffective in other matchups. Side Deck: -Harpie's Feather Duster: Destroys opponent's entire backrow, staple against Spell/Trap based decks. You do not need to worry about the Eldlixer/Golden Land GY effects because your opponent will not have another turn to play them on. -Book of Eclipse: This card works against Eldlich and Dogmatika by flipping the monsters face-down, preventing them from resolving the Golden Land continuous traps or summoning Dogmatika Fleurdelis the Knighted -Nibiru the Primal Being: This card works well against combo decks. May also work in the main deck. -Evenly Matched: Works well in certain matchups, but may be replaced. -Heritage of the Chalice and Super Quantum Red Layer: These cards can be sided in after losing a duel (so you know you're going first) because your opponent won't have any setup to counter. These increase your ability to set up the combo with Isolde.

Deck based on Tribute Summoning and denying access to extradeck monsters and also restricting Special Summoned Monsters or those that have been Normal Summoned, but were not Tribute Summoned.  Also this deck plays some unique and "exclusive" floot gates for the archetype, which allow to move the game in favor of it and restrict any other form of play.  Demostration video: https://youtu.be/tYw3BisNjYY

deck_excerpt: Raidraptor with combo post-PHRA
deck_description: Starting with any monster + 2 extenders, ends on Bardiche, CDI, Ultimate Falcon, Force Strix with 2 set RUM. While requiring 2 extenders may sound inconsistent, 25 out of 40 cards in the deck function as extenders, which makes opening 2 extenders much easier than it seems. 2 Madolche + 1 Tenyi chosen as extenders as they don't conflict with each other, and all 3 copies can be summoned out if drawn together. Combo tutorial: https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=392223-21647127 There are a few lines of play from this point: a. Make Revolution Falcon - Air Raid under Bardiche for 2 pops b. Make Satellite Cannon Falcon against a backrow deck to Spell Speed 4 Feather Duster their entire backrow c. Make Satellite Cannon Falcon under Bardiche to pop the first card they play, also burn the 2nd effect of Satellite Cannon Falcon to remove all of its materials. Make VFD.

deck_excerpt: Machina Initrack Trains with a control twist whilst still being able to OTK if needed.
deck_description: Main Starters:  Machina Metalcruncher, Inifitrack Harvester, Machina Redeployment, Heavy Forward  Extenders:  Inifinitrack Trencher, Inifinitrack Brutal Dozer, Derricrane, Bullet Train, Revolving Switchyard, Heavy Forward  Quick Reasoning For Each Card:  Machinas:  Metalcruncher: It's your best turn 1 normal summon as it grabs you whatever extender you need, it's also a level 9 so allows for Calamities  Citadel: Quick effect board clear that brings itself back from the gy when one of your monsters are destroyed. Can cause a lot of decks issues trying to get around, also really good discard fodder for switchyard and redeployment  Fortress: Can summon itself with ease, it's also an inherent summon so doesn't start a chain. When destroyed by battle it pops a card, so you can crash it to get rid of problem cards with ease. When targeted by a monster effect you can pitch a card from your opponents hand for free, this is also a continuous effect so can't be negated by cards like Borreload savage or Apollousa. Finally it is a level 7, so when combined with Harvester it allows for rank 9 plays.  Redeployment: Gives you 6 copies of Metalcruncher and if you discard a Machina card you can also search the trap card which is a very underrated card in this deck.  Overdrive: Really brings the whole deck together. You can use it to either special summon Citadel, or if Citadel is already in the GY either of the other Machina monsters. If Citadel is already in the GY it will also trigger it's effect. Due to it being a summon and then if you do destroy effect, you can protect your target with Super Dora and get the summon for free. Due to it also being able to recycle monster banished or in your GY. it lets you either recycle the whole Inifitrack combo or the Citadel if your opponent banished it.  Infinitrack:  Harvester: It's the bhest normal summon in the deck every other turn, allows for rank 9 and rank 12 plays.  Brutal Dozer: One of the decks best extenders  Trencher: Same as Dozer, not a complete garnet as Dozer can summon a Harvester for you to tribute if you do draw it, but much better in the deck.  Heavy Forward: Either gets you to your normal summon or acts as an extender if you already have 1 in hand.  Trains:  Bullet Train: The best extender in the deck. Not only is it a free summon but during the end phase you get a monster back from your GY. Essential to any deck that can use it.  Derricrane: Another really good extender, as well letting you chain block. Pops a card when detached to help you control the game  Pegasus: You mostly want to be summoning this off Switchyard, but in the later turns it is a respectable normal summon.  Night Express: Due to this deck relying on having a normal summon to get started, Night Express is needed because it adds 5 more normal summons to the deck due to being searchable off Switchyard.  Switchyard: Either gets you to 1 of your level 10's or acts as an extender. With this an d Anger Knuckle, you can put up very good defensives on your opponents turn that will set you up to pressure for game.     Reason For No Urgent Schedule:  In the current format, Trains can't really blind second anymore, as they can't make the most use out of cards like Nibiru as this will lock you out of the normal summon of metalcruncher as well as the summon of bullet train, and DRNM and Evenly will prevent you from OTK'ing which is you main goal when going second. Due to this urgent schedule is a total brick going first, and will likely just get negated going second.  Replay vs Sky Strikers: https://www.duelingbook.com/replay?id=634330-21587347 shows the grinding power of the deck as well as the choice behind some of the side deck cards.

deck_excerpt: A true control variant focusing on disrupting plays, and removing monsters on the field is how the deck will be able to withstand combo decks.
deck_description:
Pretty straightforward Dogmatika Invoked deck. A true control variant focusing on disrupting plays, and removing monsters on the field is how the deck will be able to withstand combo decks. The deck can OTK using Augoeides if an opportunity arises:
  1. Send 2 Fusion monsters (Dragon Master Knight + Any Fusion Monster you prefer) to the GY using Nadir Servant/Maximus to the GY
  2. Fusion summon Augoeides using Aleister + Fusion monster (which can be easily done with set up using Maximus/Nadir Servant to send a fusion monster to the GY)
  3. Use Augoeides to banish Dragon Master Knight to gain 5k attack which equals to 7k atk. During damage calc, discard Aleister (which you'll get back by using Invocation effect from GY) to buff atk by 1k equaling to 8k.
The OTK looks like it needs a lot of set up however it can easily do it with a Nadir Servant + Aleister/Magical Meltdown. Dragon Master Knight is also a nice target for Dogmatika Punishment to out high attack monsters such as UTC. You can also choose to run 2 Maximus. You can replace any one of the hand traps of your choice.

deck_excerpt: My take on Invoked Shaddoll this format. This deck has been very consistent with several ways to finish the opponent. A mid-tempo deck that should not
deck_description: My take on Invoked Shaddoll this format. Hand traps are pretty much staple and you need to be able to stop opponent plays so this deck runs 9 total.     This deck is pretty straightforward. I know some do not like to run Pot of Avarice however it is very much needed vs any other control/mid-tempo decks to cycle back your Shaddoll fusions once they out all of it. The goal is to lock and/or disrupt opponent plays and when an opportunity arises, you can actually OTK via Purgatrio/Shaddoll Combo with Ariel and Resh/Augoeides. Learning when to use/summon your cards and disruptions pays off with this deck.     This deck has been very consistent with several ways to finish the opponent. At most, a Mid-tempo deck and should not be in a grind game for too long as it will reduce your resources without any way to recycle them unless you use pot of avarice.

deck_excerpt: Only Destiny HEROs except for a small predaplant engine and extra deck monsters
deck_description:
The goal of this deck was to make a pure Destiny HERO deck but I caved in and added the small predaplant engine. I found myself not being able to get 2 monsters on the field without it. The only good normal summon for my pure version was Destiny HERO - Drilldark and I had to have another Destiny HERO in my hand, which isn't that hard but not good enough. Now I added my favorite engine of 3 Predaplant Orphys Scorpio and 1 Predaplant Darlingtonia Cobra. 2 monsters on the board AND a free destiny fusion? Doesn't get better than that! This deck is ever changing. Destiny HEROs are my favorite deck and I just really want to find a way to  break Fusion Destiny and D - Tactics. I have been testing many different versions that I will post inevitably. One of the biggest problems with this deck was that I needed my opponent to destroy my Destiny HERO - Dominance. Most of the time (if my opponent knew what it did) they would just ignore it and OTK me by killing my weaker monsters like Predaplant Verte Anaconda which I HATE leaving on the board. So I looked for a way to just get rid of Anaconda and destroy my own Dominance. That is when I stumbled upon Rapid Trigger. Never have I heard about this card and when I found it I thought it was the perfect card for my deck. I was looking for a quick play fusion card so I could summon Destiny HERO - Dystopia on my opponent's turn to trigger D - Tactics since D - Fusion sucks. So this card lets me fusion summon any monster on my opponents turn by destroying my monsters instead of sending them, triggering Doninance's effect? And it makes them unaffected by monsters summoned from the extra deck on top of that? Sign me up. Okay so the deck's main strategy is to summon 2 monsters onto the field and make Anaconda. I have a 40 card deck and a lot of draw power in order to find Rapid Trigger and D - Tactics. Hard drawing Fusion Destiny is good because if the opponent negates your normal summon you can play through it. Normally you want to summon Dominance with Fusion Destiny by sending Malicious, Disk Commander, and Dreadmaster. Malicious because you want him in the grave, Disk for draw 2, and Dread for level 8 that when its special summoned Destiny HEROs cannot be destroyed and you take no damage from battles with them. Summon Dystopia with Anaconda by sending Drawhand and Dynatag. Monsters you send always change but those are best choices for both monsters. For what to summon with Rapid Trigger:
  • If its your turn and all you have is Fusion Destiny and 1 Destiny HERO in hand, summon Dusktopia by destroying Dominance and the other monster on the field. You can trigger Dominance's effect and special summon 3 monsters. Link 2 of them into Xtra HERO Cross Crusader and bring back another monster to tribute to search for Destiny HERO - Plasma. Special summon a Malicious from the grave and tribute the Malicious, Cross Crusader, and the other monster for Plasma. You should have a Dusktopia still on the field who can protect Plasma and is partially protected itself from the effect of Rapid Trigger.
  • If its your opponents turn and all you were able to summon was Anaconda and Dominance, summon Predaplant Dragostapelia for 1 monster negate.
  • If its your opponents turn and you have 3 monsters on the field summon Predaplant Triphyoverutum for 1 extra deck special summon negation.
  • Experiment yourself.
Cards to side/take out: Butterspy is an extender that can chainblock, Dreamer can protect from the grave, Dark angel is not that good but is spicy spell negation, Duster and twister for spell destruction (I keep facing Domain Monarchs and Mystic Mine). Overall its not the most competitive deck but it is spicy and a lot of fun. I don't have any handtraps or other staples in the deck but feel free to add them. I would probably run 3 Called by if it were at 3.....

deck_description: Setup your field with various spells to disrupt your opponent's plays.  Search with them using the continuous spells and the Link Monsters.  Pay attention to the order you play your spells to ensure you can activate the secondary effects of the ones you desire to.  Ensure your Main Monster Zones don't have monsters for long, so you don't get locked out of your spells.  Knightmares can be used to keep hand advantage and setup a finishing play.  Darkest Diabolos, Lord of the Lair can be added from the side deck to get extra materials when tributing Knightmares or Sky Striker Ace - Raye.  Side deck is built for slight adjustments depending on the type of deck you are facing, without creating unwanted cards.

deck_excerpt: A "Chemicritter" deck, which uses its own Gemini monsters alongside some "Red-Eyes" and "Tenyi" support cards to gain board control.
deck_description:
This is my take at a "Chemicritter" deck. Before starting to talk about what the deck actually does, I want to clarify two things: First off, this is a Gemini deck, which means that you need to normally summon monsters twice to give them their printed effects; they also count as Normal monsters in the graveyard, which the deck makes use off quite a lot. Secondly, I use a small "Red-Eyes" and a small "Tenyi" engine to make the deck run smoother; I will further explain what cards I use and for what reasons I use them, but I can tell you from the start that a pure "Chemicritter" deck faces a few hurdles that I would rather like to solve with outside support.

Which brings me straight to the deck: The "Chemicritter" core consists of two copies of "Chemicritter Carbo Crab", which is both graveyard setup and a searcher as soon as you get its effects live. "Chemicritter Oxy Ox" also clocks in at three copies, since it is the most convinient way to get Rank 7 and Rank 8 monsters on the board. "Poly-Chemicritter Dioxogre" is the main beater, who is able to make the summons of Gemini monsters unnegatable while also sporting a removal effect, while the single copy of "Poly-Chemicritter Hydragon" is less powerful, but can have uses by boosting and protecting your monsters. You need both to make the most out of the copies of "Burnout" in the deck, which can be very helpful in a pinch while also having a seriously useful effect when banished from the graveyard. Three copies of "Catalyst Field" since you need this Field Spell on the board to make any respectable plays, and while the previous build had both one copy of "Terraforming" and "Metaverse", I have take them both out in this version due to the new "Chemicritter" support card in form of "Dimer Synthesis", which is better than the Field Spell searchers by a mile in this deck. The combination of being able to summon Level 5 or higher Gemini monsters without tribute, summon Gemini monsters twice and also have a removal effect at your disposal is very powerful and pretty much needed at any point during the game.

Engine-wise, the "Red-Eyes" engine is mostly there to fill the graveyard with revivable monsters. The pure version of "Chemicritters" always suffered from not having enough targets in the graveyard to work with, a problem that is easily solved by the "Red-Eyes" cards. The main idea is to either draw the single "Red-Eyes Insight" to search for "Red-Eyes Fusion", or simply start the combo with the Fusion spell. Do not worry if you think that this is simply going to end up in "Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon" again like in pretty much any other deck in existence at the moment: In this deck, the combo is summoning "Meteor Black Comet Dragon" via "Red-Eyes Fusion" by using a "Red-Eyes Black Flare Dragon" and a copy of "Mana Dragon Zirnitron" from the deck and then using the effect of the Fusion monster to ditch the single "Red-Eyes Archfiend of Lightning" for 1250 burn damage and further graveyard setup. If you started by playing "Red-Eyes Insight", you end up with the Fusion monster and every single "Red-Eyes" card in the deck in the graveyard, ready for numerous revival effects to target them. Drawing into the "Red-Eyes" monsters is no big deal, since you can use them with "Chemicritter Oxy Ox" and "Catalyst Field" and both of the Main Deck options are rather helpful when their effects go live. Only drawing "Red-Eyes Insight" after using the Fusion Spell has no further use, but that is a small price to pay.

The "Tenyi" cards in the deck are two copies of "Tenyi Spirit - Vishuda", who combines an easy summoning effects for some swarming, another monster for Rank 7 plays and a handy bounce effect in one card. The deck also runs two copies of "Fists of the Unrivaled Tenyi" to stop your opponent from doing certain things to the board. The Extra Deck monster "Berserker of the Tenyi" is only really in the deck if the opponent triggers the second effect of "Fists of the Unrivaled Tenyi", but it can technically be summoned using the normal way aswell. I included a few Gemini support cards, namely "Supervise" and "Gemini Ablation", into the mix since they help the deck with consistency and tempo. The only generic monsters in the deck are "Darkstorm Dragon", who is a technically a "Heavy Storm" on legs and therefore very helpful in certain situations, and "Mana Dragon Zirnitron", a monster that not only serves as Fusion material for "Red-Eyes Fusion", but also has an extremely helpful summoning condition while also recycling backrow. Since the opponent will try to destroy "Catalyst Field" to slow down the deck, you will often have a chance to summon this monsters and plus off its effect.

The Extra Deck is mostly a colorful mix of options you can use in various situations. The two Fusion monsters I have not talked about so far are "Superalloy Beast Raptinus", who gives all Gemini monsters their effects as long as it is on the field, and "First of the Dragons" who is helpful against deck with a lot of Effect monsters; so all the time, really. They can be summoned via "Dragon's Mirror", which makes use of the monsters in the graveyard. The Xyz options are the archetypal boss monster "Vola-Chemicritter Methydraco" (revive effect, removal and attack/target protection for Gemini monsters), "Number 38: Hope Harbinger Dragon Titanic Galaxy" (beater with added Spell negate), "Number 107: Galaxy-Eyes Tachyon Dragon" (beater with effect negation, ATK boost and bonus attacks), "Thunder End Dragon" ("Raigeki" on legs), "Red-Eyes Metal Flare Dragon" (burn card with added revive for "Red-Eyes" Normal monsters) and "Number 11: Big Eye" (steals the opposing monsters for the cost of one material and "Big Eye" attacking in the same turn). "Defender of the Labyrinth" is a surprisingly good card that provides attack boosts for your board, lowers the ATK of opposing monsters and revives a non-Effect monster (and therefore, you guessed it, a Gemini monster) from your graveyard when it leaves the field. "Knightmare Phoenix" is handy backrow removal, while "Barricadeborg Blocker" can help with issues with the Field Spell.

I personally think that "Chemicritters" are very fun to play in a more casually-minded environment. The deck has little to no reaction to the opposing plays on its own, but very much likes to just do its own stuff and see how it works out. The problem with Geminis in general is that every monster over Level 5 is a potential brick that you can only really get around by drawing into another copy of your Field Spell. In addition to that, they cannot keep up with decks that carefully manage their resources and will recover cards on a regular basis, since they will run out of cards rather quickly. But despite being Geminis and therefore being the slowest possible summons in the game, the archetype works rather well and is certainly quirky.

If you want to know more about the "Chemicritter" archetype (or other archetypes for that matter), please feel free to visit my blog here: https://cubiccreativity.wordpress.com/2020/09/19/archetype-analysis-chemicritters/

deck_excerpt: Rokket PK Codebreakers
deck_description: Rokket Dragon Link with the Codebreaker Package, building Rusty Bardiche for 2 negates (under Apollousa for 3/4) and your choice of Borrelsword Dragon with a Silverrokket into Magnarokket, or Tri-Gate Wizard co-linked with Rusty and Apollousa, and the extra Striker Dragon (with Fog Blade for backup). Rusty provides effect and attack negation, and a weird sort of grind game with 3 Fog Blade, the ability to recover Rust with Fog Blade, while Tri-Gate gets us an omni-negate that banishes. You could make Savage, but since we can banish, I think we should.  Since the pile of bricks was so huge, I wanted to run as many extenders and starters as possible, and I wanted to run 60 cards, hence the Dragonmaid engine. Since I knew the hand trap count would be light, and since I really wanted extenders, I incorporated Phantazmay. Ghost Mourner makes sense in this deck - generic effect negation is just good in the meta right now, and not having Imperm's restrictions makes it better when we're digging for answers with Phantazmay.  Updated the combo, to incorporate Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon and Borreload Savage Dragon. Full board is Apollousa with 3 negates, 1 Rusty Bardiche with 1 Fog Blade, Borreload Savage Dragon, and Dragoon. If you can see a single extender, and don't need to burn it, you can extend to 4 negates on Apollousa or a second Fog Blade. With Dragoon, if your combo gets interrupted you can make an emergency Dragoon, but the deck is fully capable of playing through negates.

deck_excerpt: Generaider provides Trickstar with a separate (and powerful) win condition while also enhancing the ability to resolve Droll+Reincarnation combos.
deck_description: Trickstar has definitely been struggling to thrive in a meta where 1 or 2-card combos run rampant and backrow decks in general seem much worse off due to cards like Lightning Storm, Red Reboot, Feather Duster, etc... But this list is both different from the average Trickstar strategy and helps it thrive.  It can be a struggle to resolve Reincarnation+Droll combos, especially with Light Stage to 1, but this list mitigates that issue with the use of Generaider Boss Fight. The ability to summon Harr or Nidhogg in combination with ripping your opponent's entire hand is a powerful tool that the deck can abuse very, very well. Simply opening Droll+Boss Fight+Reincarnation (or any extension that can retrieve these cards), similar to the Reincarnation+Droll combo, will rip your opponent's hand while also establishing an extra negate body on your field. Among other things, cards like Trap Trick only make this more consistent.  However, even without the use of the Droll combo, the Generaider engine provides Trickstar with more board presence and utility than they could ask for. The ability to establish a full board of tokens while also being able to hand rip/negate a card effect with Harr/Nidhogg gives Trickstar room to breathe and be less vulnerable to cards like Lightning Storm or handtraps. If they waste their interaction on Candina or Light Stage, they're still going to have to deal with the Generaider portion and vice versa.

deck_excerpt: Deck should cost between $80 and $130, vendor-dependent (excluding side deck techs/options). This deck is absolutely wild and lots of fun for everyone
deck_description: I'll start this out by saying that this deck should cost you anywhere from $80 - $130, depending on where you buy your cards from (and this is excluding the side deck recommendations or tech options).  Utopia package in side deck is for whether or not you wish to build the Kali Yuga lockdown variant, in which case you need Utopia Kaiser, Kali Yuga, Big Eye, and Utopia Double+Double or Nothing.  Other than that, go wild. It's better to experiment and find out what build suits your playstyle and/or meta.  PK Fire is a very unique deck that combines the use of the Phantom Knights as an easy level 3 engine that can provide relevant forms of offensive and defensive plays, namely being able to set multiples of one of the best trap cards in the game: Phantom Knights' Fog Blade. On top of this, the Burning Abyss monsters provide an easy link climbing route and can also be utilized for Phantom Knights plays, such as summoning Break Sword and (more relevantly) Rusty Bardiche.  Not to mention, the Burning Abyss cards allow you to play through disruptions and can help pick apart an established board, or at the very least force bait negations/interruptions.

deck_excerpt: six quick launch
deck_description: Dragon link combos, but more chazzly  So, discarding LV5 gets you lV7, which discarding that gets LV3, or gets Flash (if you didnt use it to start) to start your link combos. If you discard LV7 first you can get LV5 and then get Tempest. Gusto Griffin is your other best discard to summon itself and make Romulus  Artillery Catapult Turtle lets you get a LV5 on field to start your combos, but can also get Gaia the Magical Knight to summon the LV5 back from grave if you get it there first. Gaia is level 7 for an easy synchro.  Lightning is your best starter. It will trigger your Armed Dragons (or Gusto, which is the easiest way to full combo) when summoning Tempest, and will also set up the grave to summon Tempest again with his own effect. Opening Darkness Metal will even let you banish Tempest to search any Armed Dragon. Tempest can also search Darkness Metal, by discarding a card you want too!  Effect Veiler can be a surprisingly good normal summon, to make your Level 8 synchros at the end of your combo, or once Tempest is summoning itself every turn.     Basically the combo goes:  Romulus > ss Phalanx> Linkross > Martial metal> summon back Phalanx > (herald here if u want) > Halqifibrax > ss Rokket Synchron or Effect Veiler> (make formula synchron if you didn't make Herald)  then it kinda varies. If I drew Guardragon I usually activate it here to get something for elpy then move it to get Darkness Metal and 1 more dragon for Saryuja. (Tempest can also be the better card to get off Elpy, for easy Level 8 synchros, especially since it will come back every turn.)  If you don't have Guardragon, it's usually best to go for Formula Synchron, because you need one more extender to make Saryuja with four.  If Saryuja draws you Armed Dragon LV7, summoning it here is the very best way to get to LV10, (NOTE: If you have Herald you can NOT discard to summon LV10) especially since it usually draws you a good discard for it too, or another quick launch (btw Reasoning is a 7th quick launch 80% often)  From here Saryuja's arrows let you use Elpy to get a low level or Darkness Metal (if you didn't already) for Pisty, and Pisty usually gets either a Rokket Synchron or a Level 7, but can also revive Romulus to get you one more link material for an Apollousa. (Try to save Tempest's revive for around here to make your synchro)  Once you use your Guardragons, use Protector Whelp to link them off. You can then finally Link that and Saryuja for Union Carrier. This is the best time to make Borreload Savage, so it can equip Saryuja, and then Dragon Buster.     Uninterupted you can end on Herald, Borreload Savage, Draco Berserker and Buster Lock. or like, LV10, Borrelsavage, 2/3 matt apollousa, and Buster Lock.  Have fun!!!

deck_excerpt: pure world chalices
deck_description: world chalice combo: normal monster > imduk > imduk effect to ns world chalice > link off for almiraj (or lambda) > wc effect summons Lee (searchs another wc) and guardragon > link off for Lib searching succession or sometimes sorrow> guardragon ss back a normal > ss imduk again and link him off again to summon the wc from hand > you now have many things  you can search the first World Chalice for the combo if you normal summon Lee and can get a normal monster with Unexpected Dai, E-Tele or Transmodify for Venus.  (You can also use Draconnet to transmodify a shineball)  The last way to get Venus is summoning Cherubini and using Succession or Monster Reborn. You have plenty of free level 3's (Dai, E-tele, Dangers), then draconnet and chosen to make her, and can potentially search the succession and summon a chosen if you can already do the World Chalice combo.  If you can get to both Venus and World Chalice, (or just Venus and Pot of Avarice) you should be able to make a tri-gate board, or at least 4 mat apolousa and I:P/Lib for Avramax.

deck_excerpt: Salamangreat Deck post-Tin of Lost Memories.
deck_description:
Going-1st Endboards:
 
Board #1 Salamangreat Sunlight Wolf + Red-Eyes D. Dragoon + Backrow:
Typical Salamangreat setup using Salamangreat Gazelle that usually requires either Parallel eXceed or Will of the Salamangreat to SS Predaplant Verte Anaconda.
Board #2 Salamangreat Sunlight Wolf + Buster Lock + Backrow:
Same Salamangreat setup with Salamangreat Gazelle. For this setup, instead of Link Summoning Predaplant Verte Anaconda you will go into Union Carrier. You'll need one additional Cyberse on the field than you need for Board #1 to Link Summon Linguriboh to equip the Dragon Buster Destruction Sword to. A Buster Lock will be better against ED-heavy Decks than Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon but since it's not a consistent endboard you could instead end it on Salamangreat Sunlight Wolf + Bagooska + Backrow.
Board #3: Red-Eyes D. Dragoon + Buster Lock:
This is were this deck becomes more consistent. Sometimes you either won't be able to summon Salamangreat Gazelle to access your backrow or a Salamangreat Sunlight Wolf with Roar or Rage alone just won't be enough to stop your opponent. This setup works without Salamangreat Gazelle. Instead of going into Salamangreat Sunlight Wolf you go straight into Union Carrier and then use your extenders to SS Predaplant Verte Anaconda, equip Dragon Buster Destruction Sword to Predaplant Verte Anaconda and SS Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon.  
Miscellaneous:
I play 3 Super Polymerization with Predaplant Dragostapelia since Dragoon is easily splashable and even if your opponent doesn't play him this card is still a great way to deal with an already established board (especially combo deck boards) using Mudragon of the Swamp. You still have your typical OTK as a win condition using Update Jammer and Accesscode Talker. Accesscode Talker can be swapped for Topologic Zeroboros. The afore mentioned boards aren't highly consistent and are rather a show of what an endboard with this Salamangreat deck could look like. There's a plethora of other board states you could pass your turn with including everyone's favorite: hard drawing Red-Eyes Fusion to SS Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon and pass   like drawing handtraps and Parallel eXceeds only   for example having your Salamangreat Gazelle Ash'ed or your NS's effect Ghost Ogre'd with little to no follow-up  .

deck_excerpt: Bust out your old D-Hero engine cards for this 2020 revamp of a classic!
deck_description: Have you got your ultra rare copies of Destiny Draw collecting dust in your binder, dreaming about the glory days? Or maybe you're a new player and missed out on the reign of terror that was the Destiny Hero engine. Well strap in, because this is gonna be a blast from the past!  I won't lie to you, much of this deck's strength comes from leveraging the extremely easy access it has to Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon. It's the central play of the deck. We have a ton of chains that can end with positive value leading into a Verte Anaconda to set up your powerhouse boss monster.  Starting the game with any line into a Malicious into the GY gives you easy access to a Link 2 monster. Doing so with Dark Grepher, Armageddon Knight, or a Stratos into D-Draw will leave you with 2 warriors on the field, letting you link into Isolde. This is the best way to start the game, so if you have a line to get to an early Isolde that is where we begin.  Isolde then can grab you any card, generally I go for Disk Commander since he's the monster I'm the least likely to need access to later in the turn. Isolde can then dump ideally 4 equipment to special summon Stratos to then grab another card from the deck. If you've drawn into one of your equipment already, just summon whoever you can instead. Now you're back to 2 monsters and can Link into Verte Anaconda and summon your Dragoon. Isolde also conveniently sets up Divine Sword Phoenix Blade for you to get back and have a free pitch to your Dragoon every turn!  Now, that's the most basic line. If you find a way to get to 4 monsters in play (not too tall an order with all the special summons available to the deck), you can also go into Skull Dread for some extra value and then Link into Anaconda. Skull Dread is also excellent to get into play due to all of the effects we have that want cards in the deck, which he can help fix if we draw too many.  Cross-Sheep can also be accessed before going into Anaconda if you've gone 2nd and have access to Instant Fusion. This also gives an easy way into a Skull Dread link summon.  Doom Lord gives you another D-Draw target as well as a level 3 to find with Isolde. He's also lowkey pretty good on his own, getting around a lot of problematic cards.

deck_excerpt: ABC
Blind going 2nd HERO deck build that will surely end the game in a blink of an eye
deck_description:
HERO is the largest archetype of the Yu-Gi-Oh! Series, yet it doesn't seem to be able to compete with today's meta decks.  In this HERO build, we will explore on how can this deck will be able to compete or (hopefully) beat with today's meta. The main starter for this build is Vision HERO Faris, with this card in your hand including 1 any other HERO monster will surely bring you victory considering your opponent doesn't have any negation. Even if you didn't draw this card, have no worries because there are many searchers in this deck that can lead you to this card. Elemental HERO Shadow Mist, Xtra HERO Cross Crusader, and Elemental HERO Stratos can search for your main starter. Wait, there's more, this additional cards can also help you search for you missing HERO cards Reinforcement of the Army, Fusion Destiny, E-Emergency Call, and A Hero Lives. With that many cards as your searcher, have no doubt that Vision HERO Faris will be in your hands most of the time One of the most important thing to keep in mind is that you should always bait your opponent's negation so you can execute your combo without distraction. These cards are going to be your bait cards: A Hero Lives, E-Emergency Call, Reinforcement of the Army, Lightning Storm, Elemental HERO Stratos, Foolish Burial, and Forbidden Droplet. When you successfully baited your opponent, their board will be gone in no time and game will be finished in your favor So this is going to be your main combo:
  • 1. Use Faris' effect to discard Malicious or Shadow Mist to the GY
  • 1.1 If you discarded Shadow Mist, always chain link 1 shadow mist then chain link 2 Faris to prevent Shadow Mist from being negated by Ash Blossom
  • 1.1.1 Using Shadow Mist's effect search for Evil HERO Adusted Gold
  • 2. Use Faris' effect to place Vision HERO Increase to the spell/trap zone
  • 3. Use Incease's effect to send Faris to the GY, then special summon Vision HERO Vyon to the field, activate Vyon's effect to send a copy of Malicious or Shadow Mist to the GY (whoever is the one you didn't discard from Faris' effect)
  • 3.1 If you sent Shadow Mist to the GY, activate it's effect to search for Evil HERO Adusted Gold
  • 4. Use Vyon's second effect, banish Shadow Mist to search for a copy of Polymerization
  • 5. Link summon Xtra HERO Cross Crusader using Increase and Vyon, then use Crusader's effect to special summon Malicious from the GY, activate Crusader's second effect to tribute Malicious then search for Elemental HERO Liquid Soldier
  • 6. Use Adusted Gold's effect to search for Dark Calling
  • 7. Use Malicious effect in the GY to special summon another copy of itself from the deck
  • 8. Fusion Summon Elemental HERO Sunrise using Malicious and Liquid Soldier, always chain link 1 Liquid Soldier then chain link 2 Sunrise
  • 9. Through Sunrise's effect you can search a copy of Miracle Fusion, use this to fusion Summon Elemental HERO Escuridao.
  • 10. Activate Dark Calling to fusion summon Evil HERO Malicious Bane (as much as possible banish monster's that are not Destiny HERO, since you can still use them through the second copy of Cross Crusader in the Extra Deck)
Purpose of Side Deck Cards
  • Nibiru, The Primal Being - Good against pure going 1st decks like zefra, infernoble knights, megalith, etc.
  • Dinowrestler Pankratops - Good against anti-meta decks and backrow decks
  • Artifact Lancea - Good against Invoked, Dogmatika, and Banish decks
  • Mask Change - If you're forced to be going 1st against certain type of decks, siding this in will give you a higher chance to have Dark Law or perform the Absolute Zero to Acid combo
  • Forbidden Droplet - Good against going 1st decks, side this in then take out 1 Mask Change
  • Prohibition - Pretty Spicy card that i put in here (At first I was planning to use Crossout Designator but due to being bricky, I decided to use Prohibition) always call Nibiru when using this card unless you're pretty sure that you're opponent doesn't have one. If you're opponent doesn't have one you can just call a keypiece to his combo.
  • Vanity's Emptiness - Pretty self explanatory card, great card against combo decks.
  • Anti-Spell Fragrance - This card is just a less broken version of Imperial Order
  • Imperial Order - Broken card against especially against Sky Striker
  • Red Reboot - Since we're using an OTK Deck this card is a must
Things to remember:
  • If your opponent uses a targeting negate to your monster, you can chain mask change, Vision HERO Increase, or Forbidden Droplet to dodge the negation.
  • Always chain Forbidden Droplet to any of your bait cards in order to force your opponent to activate the negation. Example: You activate A Hero Lives then your opponent chains Borreload Savage Dragon, you can chain forbidden droplet to send A HERO Lives from your field to the graveyard in order to prevent it's effect being negated
  • When using Vision HERO Faris' effect, always discard Destiny HERO - Malicious or Elemental HERO Shadow Mist (Though it's more preferable to discard Malicious) so that you can trigger their effect in the graveyard. Malicious is more preferable to discard since if Faris' effect has been negated you can still use Malicious' effect to summon another copy of it from the deck then Link Summon Xtra HERO Cross Crusader.
  • Fusion Destiny is the last bait card that you should use due to it's restriction that you will be limited that you can only special summon Dark Hero Monster on the whole turn (I prefer to use this card as a last resort if Faris has been negated, in that way you can still put up a decent board).

deck_excerpt: Magistus has found a new home, Majespecter and Pendulum Magician summon Artemis while plus-ing. Theologia also allows Magistus as an engine. Easy Apol
deck_description: LET'S GO! Main concept here is to play regular pendulum spellcaster good stuff (Pend Magician, Majespecter, and Endymion) while having access to Magistus via 3 Theologia, 3 Verre, and Magistus Endymion. There's no streamlined combo, you gotta work with what you draw. Need a lot of practice to gain full advantage on each hand you draw. The Theologia route is the most common way to access Magistus, any random low lv spellcaster can be an Artemis which you can slap Theologia on for another Artemis but as equip to search Verre. Verre can be pend summoned to search fusion spell for Aiwass. To extend the play, pend lineup comes in handy. Usually we use Cross-Sheep (Aiwass can trigger it) and Selene (best link climber). Magistus: 3 Theologia and Verre (best cards), 1 each Magistus Endymion (Spell Power Mastery another target and Artemis equip access), Magistus Invocation (combo piece), Vritra (Verre another target, dead if drawn double of it with no Magistus in GY). Pend Magician: Harmonizing, 3 Duelist Alliance, and Pendulum Call (best cards). Dragonpulse (Dai, Harmonizing, and Call target while being low lv for Artemis), White Wing (same reason and is a wind spellcaster for Majespecter), and Chronograph-Timegazer. Double Iris is there as another Duelist Alliance and Call target. Majespecter: 3 Bunbuku (best card), 1 each of Kyubi, Ogama, and Tornado. We dont play the Majespecter spell lineup because of scaling problem. Yata, the spell searcher has same 5 scale with Ogama while Kyubi is scale 2 giving Bunbuku versatility. The spells also cant be used going first which means cant help Servant Endymion anyway. Endymion: 3 Spell Power, 1 Servant (low lv for Artemis and wind spellcaster for Majespecter), 1 Mighty Master (free spell negation), 1 Magister Endymion (another servant target, low lv for Artemis, and has good scale). We dont run Jackal King as it has bad scale and monster negation is covered by Apollousa already (doesnt prevent Nibiru tho). The rest of it is just good spells for Servant spell counter and Selene requirement like Spellbook engine (insta 2 spells), Unexpected Dai (free Artemis), Instant Fusion (free Artemis while triggering Cross-Sheep), Upstart, and Called by the Grave. Extra deck is combo pieces with generic stuff. 3 Artemis (as spare, we use 2 in first turn), 2 Selene (combo piece and Accesscode follow-up), Masq (low effort interruption), Crowley (for plus). Side deck depends on matchup.   Pros: Best deck. Majespecter is immune to Impermanence and Veiler. Cons: Pend mechanic bad, need cards to put in scale and pend summon from extra deck is limited by extra/link zone. UNBAN KIRIN.

deck_excerpt: It’s an unpretentious deck, which, however, will surprise you, as well as being able to play like all the other blue-eyes today, but remaining pure.
deck_description:
Introduction: Main Level Monsters:1 and 8 Main Summons: Hand, deck and Graveyard  ||  Extra Summons: Link, Xyz, Synchro and Fusion Key cards: The White Stone of Legend, Crystron Halqifibrax + Linkross, Maiden with eyes of blue, Sage with eyes of blue. Tier Meta: Non-Meta, For Fun Difficult to use 2/5 Dead Hands:3/20
COMBO

Before Crystron Halqifibrax<!--more-->There are probably 2 simpler and more common ways to do this, summoning 2 tuners, and this can be done using the second normal of Mausoleum of White Or using Protector with Eyes of Blue. The 2nd way is by Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon + any tuner.

Also there are always common alternative ways, that allow us to have an extra monster, in addition to the materials for Halqifibrax.

Fibrax + 1 Monster can be lev.8 or 1: Normal Summon Sage with Eyes of Blue search Maiden with Eyes of Blue which is normal summoned thanks to Mausoleum of White, then we activate the field effect that targets maiden and send Dragon Core Hexer from the deck to the graveyard, in this way the maiden effect is activated, which allows us to summon Blue-Eyes White Dragon from hand, deck or graveyard.
Fibrax + 1 monster lev. 8: Normal summon Protector with Eyes of Blue and special summon Maiden with Eyes of Blue from the hand, then, we activate the protector effect to summon blue-eyes white dragon from the hand, by destroying the Maiden which, having been targeted, makes us summon a blue-eyes white dragon from the hand, deck or graveyard.

There are other ways that even make us summon 2 level 8 in addition to fibrex, but require more cards and therefore are not always possible. so I will not explain them to you so as not to lengthen the text too much, in addition to the fact that you yourself can understand very well how to do it

After Crystron Halqifibrax

<!--more-->The combo starts from the Crystron halqifibrax which summones the white stone of legend, linkross which summones 2 tokens, then formula synchron, Martial Metal Marcher which summones again the stone with which we summon guardragon elpy, then with linkross and Martial Metal Marcher we summon Protector Whelp of the Destruction Swordsman, so we can use the effect of elpy to summon starliege seyfert with which we search Chaos Dragon Levianeer, Dragon core Hexer or Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon. We summon Chaos Dragon Levianeer by banishing 3 light monsters so as to summon a level 8 dragon from the graveyard. We summon guardragon pisty with which we recover a banished monster, then we summon Saryuja Skull Dread with which we summon from our hand, Dragon Core Hexer with which we summon Ultimaya Tzolkin, which allows us to summon Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon. Then thanks to the eyes of blue spellcasters we summon the 8 levels necessary to summon the 2 xyz rank 8, Number 38: Hope Harbinger Dragon Titanic Galaxy and Number 90: Galaxy-Eyes Photon Lord.
Consideretions

The deck struggles to keep up with the times as far as stability is concerned, in fact with adversary negatives, the deck is unable to move forward, and this is strange because it has several starter cards, but they depend a little too much on normal and / or therefore also on Mausoleum of White. There is a lack of useful Main supports but they are not coming. It’s a deck that currently if used, it is played with other decks such as Danger! or Rokket but which I don't like because they don't reflect true Blue-Eyes. It is a deck that, although it follows the usual combo we are used to by now and that personally has also tired me, remains a fun deck to play. Hindered a LOT by the extra 15-card deck of which most of the slots are occupied by cards that are used exclusively for the combo. Even with these problems and doubts, the deck pleasantly surprised me, even managing a combo denied to hold on and do something.  

Rest in Peace

Number 95: Galaxy-Eyes Dark Matter Dragon

The Combos and Final Board:

As already mentioned, the combo is always the same, but before summoning Crystron Halqifibrax and then starting the combo, based on the first hand, you can make different combinations to summon a tuner plus another monster.

Usually the final board is composed of:

Ultimaya Tzolkin, Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon, Number 38: Hope Harbinger Dragon Titanic Galaxy, Number 90: Galaxy-Eyes Photon Lord, and sometimes Blue-Eyes Alternative Ultimate Dragon.

SIDE DECK

Must Have:

Fantastical Dragon Phantazmay is great side card 'cause it's a dragon monster target of Return of the Dragon Lords and allows you to draw 1 or more cards and is can be used at the end of the board as an extra negation. Dark Ruler No More is the perfect going second card against combo decks, because it allows us to do whatever we want without interruption. Cosmic Cyclone which, if desired, can very well be replaced by Twin Twister which against some decks is even better, are fundamental cards to destroy and in some cases negate, spell cards or annoying traps of our opponent. Red Reboot as drnm is used to not have interruptions, but it is a card that can also be used going first, which we mainly use against deck controls, which have more than one trap. Linkuriboh is a card that should be played on the Main Deck, but which I could not find a place for, as well as protecting us from an opponent's attack, it can be useful at the beginning of the combo. Azure-Eyes Silver Dragon is above all an archetype card that I regret not being able to find a place, because it’s really useful for defending our dragons, as well as giving more sense to Blue-Eyes Spirit Dragon which allows us to summon even in the opponent's turn. azure-eyes or other Light Synchro Dragon . Which, with the current extra deck it cannot do because it has no one to summon. CloudeCastle + True King of All Calamities, Calamities is one of the most broken cards in the game at the moment and being able to play it in this deck is great, even if it's not an easy thing, since we should have a synchro lev. 9 to the gy and summon cloudcastle.

Other cards that may be useful:

Nebula Dragon, the second copy of this card, honestly I don't think it can be who knows how useful, since if we want to use it, we cannot summon our spellcasters in any way. So it's only useful maybe in our second round or if we're in bad shape and that's the only thing we can do. Black Rose Moonlight Dragon is a card that we can summon thanks to the blue-eyes spirit Dragon, which returns an opponent's monster to the hand. And it can be used in conjunction with a tuner to summon Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon.

-

DISCORD

https://discord.gg/tct2cZZ-

deck_excerpt: A combo deck that sends your opponent's hand & field to the GY and summons Borreload Savage Dragon and Five-Headed Link Dragon from a single Isolde.
deck_description: This is a meta-competitive combo deck that aims to send the opponent's entire hand and field to the GY with Sky Scourge Norleras, and end on Borreload Savage Dragon and Five-Headed Link Dragon, from a single Isolde. The combo: -Summon Isolde. Use its effect to search any Warrior. -Use Isolde's other effect to mill 4 equip spells (Except D.D.R., including Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade and Cursed Bamboo Sword if possible) and summon Armageddon Knight from your Deck (If Armageddon Knight or Plaguespreader Zombie is in your hand, get Dark Grepher instead). -Add Broken Bamboo Sword to your hand with Cursed Bamboo Sword's effect, and mill Plaguespreader Zombie with Armageddon Knight (Or Dark Grepher). -Put any dead draw you got on top of the deck (Or the warrior you got with Isolde's effect, if you don't have any) on top of your deck to Summon Plaguespreader. -Summon Halqifibrax with Isolde and Plaguespreader. Use its effect to summon Vylon Cube. -Use Vylon Cube and Armageddon Knight to summon Shooting Riser Dragon. If your opponent has an extra monster zone occupied, summon it under that zone or on the same side. Use Cube's effect to search D.D.R., and Shooting Riser Dragon's to mill any Warrior. -Banish Isolde and Armageddon Knight from the GY to add Phoenix Blade from your GY to your hand. -Activate D.D.R., discarding Phoenix Blade to Summon Armageddon Knight. Use its effect to mill Zephyros the Elite. -Use Zephyros' effect to summon itself by returning D.D.R. to the hand. -Banish Armageddon Knight and one of the Warriors you used to summon Isolde  from the GY to add Phoenix Blade from your GY to your hand. -Activate D.D.R., discarding Phoenix Blade to Summon Armageddon Knight. Use its effect to mill Summoner Monk. -Summon Dugares the Timeless using Zephyros and Armageddon Knight.  Summon it next to Shooting Riser Dragon, but not in the center zone. Use its effect to summon Summoner Monk. -Use Summoner Monk's effect to summon Chaos Valkyria, discarding Broken Bamboo Sword. -Summon Selene, Queen of the Master Magicians using Monk and Halqifibrax, so it does not point to any monsters except Chaos Valkyria. Use its effect to remove 3 spell counters and revive Summoner Monk. -Use Summoner Monk's effect to summon Rescue Ferret. -Use Monk and Chaos Valkyria to summon a Link 2 Knightmare, if your opponent has something to destroy, otherwise summon Baba Barber. -Summon Saryuja Skull Dread using Selene and everything it points to, except Rescue Ferret. If you have a monster in your hand you need to summon, use Dugares or Shooting Riser Dragon too. -Use Ferret's effect to summon Doomdog Octhros, Plaguespreader Zombie, and Omni Dragon Brotaur. -If you can, Special Summon a monster from your hand with Saryuja's effect. -Summon Knightmare Unicorn to the left or right zone Saryuja points to, using Plaguespreader, Octhros, and any other monster except except Brotaur and Saryuja. If you do not have Baba Barber in the GY, summon it first, then use it as link material. Use Octhros' effect to search Sky Scourge Norleras. -Use Brotaur to summon Guardragon Pisty, and use Pisty's effect to revive Brotaur. Use Brotaur's effect to target Knightmare Unicorn and search Chaos Betrayer. -Use everything you control to summon Five-Headed Link Dragon. -Banish Chaos Valkyria, Doomdog Octhros, Knightmare Unicorn, and Baba Barber to summon Sky Scourge Norleras. Use Valkyria's effect to mill Neo Space Connector. -Use Norleras' effect to send everything on the field and each player's hand to the GY (except Five-Headed Link Dragon), and draw a card. -Put the card you drew on top of the deck to summon Plaguespreader Zombie from the GY. -Banish 1 LIGHT and 1 DARK monster from your GY to summon Chaos Betrayer from the GY. -Use Plaguespreader Zombie and Chaos Betrayer to summon Borreload Savage Dragon. Equip Saryuja Skull Dread to it. Deck Breakdown: Main Deck: -Reinforcement of the Army--"Infernoble Arms - Durendal": These cards focus on getting Isolde up as consistently as possible. I included 3 Neo-Spacian Aqua Dolphins because you will want to use its effect as much as possible, to remove any hand traps your opponent may have, and it can make Isolde with any warrior that can be Special Summoned. -Divine Sword - Phoenix Blade--Chaos Betrayer: These cards are part of the main combo, as detailed above. -Called by the Grave--Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring: These cards are used to counter anything that might threaten the combo.  They can be changed out based on the current meta & personal budget. Extra Deck: -Invoked Raidjin: This is the best Warrior I could find that can be summoned with Instant Fusion., with the ability to flip an opponent's monster face-down. -Everything else: These cards are part of the combo. I have a second Isolde in case the first one gets negated by Gamma or Fleurdelis. Side deck: These cards are useful against a variety of decks, and can be switched based on the meta & your budget. More info on them below. Support Cards: -Called by the Grave: Useful against Ash Blossom and Effect Veiler. -Prohibition: This card can stop any specific card that poses a threat to the combo, unless it is already on the field. -Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring: Good for stopping other combo decks, or Gamma. Will also be good to have when/if we get Crossout Designator. -Red Reboot: Good for stopping on-theme traps from Eldlich and Dogmatika, as well as Impermanence. -Evenly Matched: Can clear all but 1 card going second, or at least force a negate. Most effective against Eldlich decks, and may be sided against other matchups. Side Deck: -Cosmic Cyclone: Good removal against many Spell/Trap-based decks. -Dark Ruler No More: Shuts down combo decks, but relatively ineffective in other matchups. -Harpie's Feather Duster: Destroys opponent's entire backrow, staple against Spell/Trap based decks. You do not need to worry about the Eldlixer/Golden Land GY effects because your opponent will not have another turn to play them on. -PSY-Framegear Gamma: Good for stopping an opponent's combo, or to stop Eldlich from being summoned.  May also work well in main deck. -Gameciel the Sea Turtle Kaiju: Good one-card removal, can be replaced based on the decks you expect to face. -Infinite Impermanence: Good negation, but not budget-friendly. Can easily be replaced with Forbidden Chalice.
