deck_excerpt: The Akiza deck, with the support of some predaplant cards and generic plant, manages thanks to the extra deck to have its say.
deck_description:
Introduction: Main Level Monsters:1,3,4; Main Summons: Hand,deck and Graveyard| |Extra Summons: Link, Synchro and Fusion Key cards: Lonefire Blossom, Red Rose Dragon, Predaplant Ophrys Scorpio, Evil Thorn, Garden Rose Maiden, Crystron Halqifibrax, Linkross. Difficulty to use: 3/5
COMBO
1 Card combo or 2 Card Combo: Just summon Lonefire Blossom or if you don't have it, Rose Girl and Evil Thorn are enough to make a full combo, that you will find in the video below, because it is easier to show you. Tips and Tricks: Try to summon an extra monster initially or later to summon Crossrose Dragon so you don't have to waste the effect of Garden Rose Maiden. If you have Rose Girl in the graveyard and you control a plant monster, activate the effect to return it to your hand, so that you have a discard card for Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon or World Carrotweight Champion. In the deck there are some handtrap lightning rods like Rose Princess, White Rose Cloister, Foolish Burial and then Dotscaper but also One for One. Which are useful but not necessary extenders and therefore can be sacrificed and then left free to the starters.
Considerations
It's a deck that i love, i think it's one of my most successful lists, is a deck that with some other support could be really interesting even to be part of the sea of ​​rogue decks. Very balanced and consistent it is difficult to brick. If it doesn't suffer too much negations, it's if it has "handtrap lightning rods", even with bad hands, he can get by fairly well. The Cards:
  • Lonefire Blossom is a really good card, it does not say once per turn and allows us to summon any plant monster from the deck, we will mainly use it to summon Predaplant Ophrys Scorpio and Spore.
  • Rose Girl is our main extender which is also a tuner which can be very useful in some situations. Also it can come back in hand which is great for summoning World Carrotweight Champion.
  • Black Garden is a Field Spell that we can use in 2 ways, the first is to exploit the tokens to cover ourselves in defense by halving the attack of the opposing monsters and the second is to give plant tokens to summon a monster from the gy, which is a effect that most of the time i didn't need to activate.
  • Crossrose Dragon is a really good card that we can use both in our turn, often to summon Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram which allows us to add the Blessed Winds trap, and in our opponent's turn by giving a token created by Black Garden to summon Black Rose Dragon or Black Rose Moonlight Dragon.
  • Aromaseraphy Jasmine, we go to use it mainly when we start with Evil Thorn and Rose Girl, and we need it to summon Lonefire Blossom and then start the combo.
 

The Combos and Final Board:

It's a deck that prefers to go first, because it bothers the opponent a lot as well as the board for Black Garden, starting first without too many negations and with a normal hand it manages to make the combo and often to win, then thanks to the side deck he adapts very well to our opponent giving up slightly to the power of the final board.

The board of a full combo is made up of:

Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon, Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon, Borreload Savage Dragon, Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram + Blessed Winds and Black Garden.

Side Deck

Must Have:

Dark Ruler no More is a staple going second too strong not to be played, perfect board breaker. Psy-Framegear Gamma very useful in this deck since we have several effects, which are activated by cost leaving the field free and therefore allow us to activate gamma in response to hand trap. Ghost Belle & Haunted Mansion it is the perfect hand trap being earth and therefore can be used in the cemetery to summon Gigantes or True King Lithosagym, the disaster. Harpie's Feather Duster against the control decks it's perfect, Konami put it at 1 and therefore we use it. Red Reboot this card is also against controls or decks that use different traps including Infinite Impermanence.

Black Rose Dragon obviously is to be played and is the replacement for Black Rose Moonlight Dragon.

Other cards that may be useful:

The following cards replace Red-Eyes Dark Dragoon and Muddy Mudragon. We are going to remove these cards, because we summon them at the end of the board and against some opponents they are difficult to summon. And let's insert cards that make us play and can allow us to get out of some uncomfortable situations. We are going to play them, in those duels in which we know we cannot do full combo.

Traptrix Allomerus is not super easy to summon, but it has both great effects. We can use it in our turn to get out of some bad situations using the first effect or we can use it in the opponent's turn in combo with Blessed Winds and Aromaseraphy Sweet Marjoram. Leviair the Sea Dragon Same speech as the Traptrix, we use it to get out of some complicated situations.
- UPDATE update 1.2-> Added Cards:True King Lithosagym, the Disaster, 2x Gigantes, Dark Rose Fairy, Dotscaper, 3x Ghost Belle & Haunted Mansion, Dried Winds. / Removed Cards: Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring, Effect Veiler, Droll & Lock Bird, Naturia Beast, Called by the Grave. update 1.5-> Added Cards:Rose Lover, Red Reboot, Leviair the Sea Dragon. /Removed Cards: True King Lithosagym, the Disaster, Dried Winds, Knightmare Unicorn.

deck_excerpt: Gouki Deck Profile with Combo Tutorial
deck_description: The Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game Known as the Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game (遊☆戯☆王オフィシャルカードゲーム, Yū-Gi-Ō Ofisharu Kādo Gēmu) in Asia, is a Japanese collectible card game developed and published by Konami. It is based on the fictional game of Duel Monsters created by manga artist Kazuki Takahashi, which is the main plot device during the majority of the manga franchise, Yu-Gi-Oh, and its various anime adaptations and spinoff series. "Gouki" is an archetype of EARTH Warrior monsters used by George Gore (The Gore), Kenmochi, and Yoroizaka in Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS (the former in Seasons 1 and 3, and the latter two in Season 2). All of its non-Link members have 0 DEF. This archetype debuted in Code of the Duelist.  If you have any questions you can chat with me in my channel  https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=FmLzaK7C-Wc

deck_excerpt: Anti-meta control strategy using Volcanic engine
deck_description: Lots of control pieces to slow your opponent as you set up your board. Grind out advantage and wipe your opponents board on their main phase as needed.  Pot of Duality as our card draw of choice. It doesn't provide actual card advantage like Extravagance or Desires, but our deck needs specific cards more than it needs a lot of cards. Extravagance is a nonbo with a lot of our other card draw effects, and Desires wiping random cards from our deck is much too steep a cost to pay here. Thankfully we don't special summon much, so Pot of Duality slots in quite well.  This deck plays a lot like an old school control deck and is very budget friendly to boot. We don't really use our extra deck much beyond the occasional Linkuriboh or Link-2 off of Crackdown. Fossil Warrior Skull Knight and Elder Entity N'tss are really just tech cards for Dogmatika.  Note Phantom Knights' Fog Sword + There Can Be Only One creates a soft lock against any deck relying on one creature type!

deck_excerpt: Ancient Gears and Trains have some awesome synergy. Summon Ancient Gear Ballista with ease and use the Rail Cannons, Reactor Dragon and Howitzer to th
deck_description: Ancient Gears and... Trains?? Okay, hear me out... [Updated list/Strategy Guide V.1.4] The guide will have discrepancies between it and the deck but that's just because I'm lazy and can't be bothered updating the deck's guide past the 1.2 revision - but I continuously update the deck so I thought it was worth updating the list at least. No seriously, Ancient Gears have some rather good synergy with Trains since both decks are entirely EARTH Machines and both archetypes have a lot of generic support for EARTH Machines, not just Railway or Ancient Gears specifically. Ancient Gear Ballista is the core combo card of this Deck, pretty much the entire Main Deck is built to swarm Ballista out as much as possible since he can be summoned with any 2 EARTH Machines, not just Ancient Gears. Trains also open the deck to the Rank 10 XYZs. Gustav Max + Howitzer burn on top of all that battle damage? Yes please! MAIN DECK Super Express Bullet Train Three copies. You always want to be seeing this guy. If you control all EARTH Machines it can Special Summon itself for free, and during the end-phase it returns a Machine in your GY to your hand if it was sent there that turn, which is more useful than it seems, and it triggers during your opponent’s end phase if sent to the GY during their turn as well. Use Knuckle’s effect to Special Summon it during their turn, detach it from your R10 XYZs or tribute it for Machina Citadel's nuke effect and return whatever you think you'll need for your turn. Ancient Gear Box's search effect will activate if added back from the GY by Bullet Train too, giving you access to double the resources for next turn. Trigger this effect as often as you can, obviously. Heavy Freight Train Derricrane Two copies. Free Special Summon if you summon another EARTH Machine. If detached from a R10 XYZ it can pop a card. Mostly used as the free summon to get Ballista out. However, it makes Gustav Max’s phat burn or Super Dora's quick effect to protect itself a little bit more powerful. Machina Citadel Now at two copies since the original post. I've added a lot more ways to get rid of it from the hand and Deck. Since it’s not as likely to sit in your hand forever I think two copies can work now as the Deck is a lot better once Citadel is in the mix, and I do want to see it more often than I did. You don't really want to draw it, but if you do, Anchor Drill, Frame, Knuckle and Droplet help to get it out of there and on to the field or GY where it's useful. Prioritise getting him to the GY as fast as possible. Get him out of the Deck with Schedule, Foolish or Scrap Recycler. It's also worth noting Citadel is level 10 which makes him a prime candidate to go into the R10 XYZs but make sure to detach him first so you're still covered by his Special Summon effect in the GY. You can also use that effect to chain block Howitzer's effect when that's triggered at the same time. ALSO, you can combo his monster nuke effect with Knuckle since that can Special Summon Bullet Train during the opponent's turn and Citadel can tribute it off making use of its’ high ATK, and you can return an EARTH Machine during the end-phase off Bullet Train's effect as well. Keep the pressure up!! You can use this to dodge effects and other disruption too. Ancient Gear Reactor Dragon One copy, down from 2. The loss of VFD means there's no real use in running two anymore, too many big machines means too many bricky machines. You won’t be able to use the first Reactor to pop another Geartown and go for a second Reactor, but that trade in power is worth the increase in consistency. Not having one at all limits Howitzer’s effectiveness and your power ceiling too heavily. He'll still does most of the heavy hitting and can be brought out "easily" with Ballista's effect to pop Geartown or after Howitzer is destroyed. If you still control Reactor Dragon and Ballista (or any other Machine), I usually go into Knuckle during MP2. 3000 ATK beatsticks with no protection don't do much for you nowadays during the opponent's turn, at least Knuckle can recycle Bullet Train for advantage off his effect during their turn and set you up again for your next turn. Ancient Gear Box Two copies. I tried three, but that was too many. If added to your hand outside of being drawn, you can search for Frame or my personal favourite new target: Infinitrack Anchor Drill (500 DEF Wooo!). This Deck can trigger Box off Wyvern and Bullet Train's effects. Use Box to gather more resources to fuse with, set up for the next turn with Anchor Drill or search Frame out to discard a Citadel stuck in your hand being useless and trade it for an Ancient Gear Fusion. *whispers* It's free card advantage. *Deep Breath** Flying Pegasus Railroad Stampede Three copies. If summoned, this card summons another EARTH Machine from your GY, which is pretty much any monster in the Deck. Ideally, target Bullet Train if you have it to trigger its’ recycle effect during the end-phase, otherwise any monster will do. Bullet Train can then recycle Pegasus and you can do it all over again. This is essentially a card to make Ballista with, or if you use its’ second effect you can go into the R10 XYZs by copying the level of another monster you control, either Bullet Train, Derricrane or Citadel. This guy infinitely comboing with Bullet Train is the reason I play 2 Gustav Max over 2 Super Dora. Infinitrack Anchor Drill Brand new addition to the deck! Three copies! This card is so good, I totally missed it when building the original Deck (thanks PurpleJesus7). If summoned, this card Special Summons another EARTH Machine from your hand, and DOES NOT negate its' effects. It's a one card Ballista, it yeets Citadel right out of your hand and gives you access to spicy Dingirsu plays thanks to its’ second effect of level manipulation shenanigans, similar to Pegasus. Ancient Gear Wyvern Three copies. The ye olde searcher for any Ancient Gear card you want, except itself. It does have an annoying drawback which prevents you from Setting any cards for the rest of the turn after you use Wyvern's effect, apparently searching Ancient Gear Reborn and setting it that turn was too OP. Remember to Set all the backrow you want to use during your opponent's turn before searching with this card. I tend to Set all my cards before I start my combos, just in case. It’s a bad habit in any other situation other than this one. Search Box for another search (Wyvern searches Anchor Drill!?), Fortress for protection, or search whatever you want- I'm not your dad. Ancient Gear Frame One copy, down from two. It was already mostly there for the name, I cut it back due to the lack of room in the Deck but kept one for the discard (for Citadel) that comes in handy once in a blue moon, and it is a target for Box when you need the materials for Chaos Giant. Frame can discard a card and search Ancient Gear Fusion (since it lists Ancient Gear Golem in its' card text). It does have other effects but we don't run either Golem or Ultimate Pound because bricks (:pepehands:), so those effects, whilst good- are irrelevant. It's an okay card, but if you want room for more trains or something else you want to splash, this card is probably the one to cut. Ancient Gear Hunting Hound Two copies. Three is too many. Burns for 600 on Normal Summon and has a “Poly” effect that can Fusion Summon either Howitzer or Chaos Giant. I don't need to explain why he's in here or what I do with him. Scrap Recycler Another new addition. Two copies. This card is just another Foolish for Citadel, and it's an EARTH Machine so you can still Special Summon your Trains off Scrap’s summon, and go into Ballista after you've dumped Citadel to the GY. It can also dump Bullet Train to the GY if you already have Citadel. I've not once used its' recycle effect but it's there if you want to recycle a Box and Anchor Drill for a DRAWW MONSTA CARDO!! Urgent Schedule Three copies (now affordable for all you budget players!!). This is your power card, this is, and I repeat, this is NOT Ash bait. Schedule Special Summons 2 monsters of choice from the Deck, one high-level and one low-level monster, if your opponent controls more monsters than you do. Always pick Citadel as the high-level monster if he isn't already in the GY, otherwise pick Bullet Train or Derricrane, situation depending. Usually, I pick Box as the low-level monster if I intend to recycle it off Bullet Train that turn or if Box is not already in circulation. Otherwise, Pegasus or Wyvern are both good targets to get in circulation. If you already have everything you want in circulation summon either Scrap Recycler if Citadel is already in the GY (or is also being summoned off Schedule) since he’s pretty useless otherwise, or Hunting Hound as a last choice. Ancient Gear Fusion Down to two copies from three. The Deck's core strategy is moving away from Fusion Summoning due to better access to Citadel and Ballista plays, so this card isn't as important to see in your first hand. If you need it, just search it off Wyvern or Frame. It's a poly, that's it really. It's got redundant/irrelevant Golem effects which we don't use. It can't be responded to if Fortress is face-up, which is pretty cool. This card makes Howitzer 99% of the time. 1 in 100 games you might go into Chaos Giant if you've got the materials to spare or your opponent has no outs to it. However, the threat of being able to go into Chaos Giant at any time will keep your opponent on edge. Ancient Gear Fortress Two copies. Your opponent cannot respond to your Ancient Gear effects and Ancient Gear monsters you control cannot be targeted or destroyed the turn they’re summoned. Amazing. "Response? Yes? TOO BAD BITCH FORTRESS SAY NO" - actually me one time. The single best support card for Ancient Gears since Ballista. Although in this Deck it manly protects your Ballista plays rather than blanket protect your entire fucking Deck since we play a mix of other archetypes' cards. Purer builds should always run three. It's still incredibly good at protecting your main combo piece, and it's also got the signature Ancient Gear pop-float (only in the S/T zone, so no Magical Hats shenanigans this time), but it locks you to Ancient Gears for the turn (No Anger Knuckle or Gustav Max in the MP2, remember that). I don’t recommend destroying it with Ballista, but if you have nothing else it’ll do. Fortress is also an amazing card to bait the opponent’s negates with, they'll know that if they don't negate or destroy this card, they won't be able to stop anything else you do for the rest of the turn (not necessarily true, but I imagine that's what they're thinking since it gets negated A LOT). It doesn't stop your opponent to responding to the resolution of an Ancient Gear effects though, keep that in mind. It also doesn't stop the opponent from negating Geartown or its' effect since it isn't an "Ancient Gear" card, for some reason. Always Set your Geartowns folks. Geartown Otherwise known as "Kaboom Town*" since it literally never survives on the field for more than a turn. Two copies, down from three. Searched off Ballista and then almost always immediately blown up by it too. I wouldn't want to live there. You don't always have to summon Reactor Dragon off Geartown, sometimes Special Summoning Wyvern for the search can help more in the long run (or to push for a Chaos Giant), or summoning Howitzer from the GY (or Megaton Golem if you play him), even better if Citadel is in your GY for suicide shenanigans. Forbidden Droplet Three copies. Yes, I know it's a $100+ card but I already own three copies so I put Droplets in here because this is my Deck after all and they’re really good disruption, keeping your monsters alive and good at getting Citadel out of your hand if he's chilling in there etc. etc. It's a great card, you don't need me to tell you that or how to use it. For budget players: try out Chalice, Ash, or more Called Bys if it wasn't always taking a tour bus through the forbidden and limited realms. If you're feeling more "A good defence is a good offence", try out some generic 'going second' cards like Dark Ruler (which is better? No damage or no board?), Nibiru, or an assortment of Kaijus and the like. Called By The Grave Because fuck you Ash. Foolish Burial Limited to one. Used to dump Citadel to the GY where he belongs. If starting out with only Pegasus, you can dump a target to the GY to use it as a target for Pegasus' effect. It can bait a negate if you're trying to get Schedule off and it also dumps targets (Box) for Bullet Train to recycle, Monster Reborn to Special Summon (if you're desperate), or Ancient Gear Reborn for next turn plays (if you're even more desperate). Monster Reborn Limited to one. It does what it does. This Deck needs all the combo extenders it can get. Besides, your GY is usually full of massive beatsticks or annoying Howitzers, Reborn comes in handy. Ancient Gear Reborn One copy, although I played around with two. Our one and only Trap Card. It's okay, but it's a little slow. I run just the one because Wyvern can search it when summoned during the opponent's turn and you'll be able to Set it during your turn. It is kinda nifty though; you can chain the effect to Knuckle (if it tributes itself and you control no monsters thereafter) and/or Schedule to get double the monsters. Just listen to the satisfying sound of your opponent's life points dropping constantly as you reborn Howitzer over and over again. EXTRA DECK Ancient Gear Howitzer Two copies, down from three. The bread-and-butter Ancient Gear fusion monster. Probably one of the most annoying cards for your opponent to deal with. It burns, floats, AND is immune to all other card effects. Its' Floaty Mc. Float Face effect isn't once per turn (Its' burn effect is though). You can suicide this into bigger monsters and Special Summon Ancient Gear Reactor Dragon (or any Ancient Gear) from the Deck to do the hittin' Howitzer couldn't. If Citadel in your GY you'll also get to summon him off Howitzer's suicide, which also chain blocks Howitzer's float (or vise-versa). Chaos Ancient Gear Giant One copy. This is your Hulk Smash, a fucking MASSIVE beatstick that will almost always end the game if your opponent can't deal with it. He’ll do what Hulk did to Loki to your unfortunate opponent at the other end of the stick. Chaos Giant is totally immune to Spells and Traps, but vulnerable to monster effects (God, I wish it were the other way around). Although he’s much better protected with Fortress up, if you need a big beatstick, you don't get bigger than this. Well, no, that's not quite true, you do, but it can't attack multiple times like Chaos Giant can... oh wait, it does that too!?? It's okay though, this deck runs both. Ancient Gear Ballista The Deck Master. Three copies. This card searches Geartown or any Ancient Gear monster, then, in the case of Geartown, immediately blows it up and makes one of your opponent's monsters ATK/DEF 0, making hitting them over the head with a 3000 ATK beatstick that much more satisfying. He's also an Ancient Gear (I forget that sometimes) so once you've done your things you can use him as material for a Howitzer or LINK Ballista off into Knuckle for railway shenanigans, it's a waste to just leave him out there, he doesn't really do anything for you during your opponent's turn. Consider running Apollousa to make use of Ballista’s LINK 2 rating and whatever’s left on your field. Apollo with two or three negates is still fairly good. Double Headed Anger Knuckle One copy, two if you're feeling it. He can summon your level 10s from the GY, or himself, which comes in handy a lot, and comes in CLUTCH when you're top decking because literally any card you draw can do the 'Knuckle into Bullet Train into a Citadel field nuke' wombo-combo. You can use this effect to dodge other targeting or disruptive effects too. High priority to get into circulation if Citadel is in the GY, if not, constantly making use of Bullet Train’s recycle is still really, really good. Number 41: Bagooska the Terribly Tired Tapir I added one copy to the Deck just for some turn 1 plays since the Deck doesn't really have any. You can't use Schedule, Ballista, and ending on just Knuckle or Howitzer isn't exactly a fantastic unbreakable board. Its effect isn’t as useful with LINKS since they can't be turned to Defence and negated, but it still stops a lot of plays dead in their tracks, which is good enough really. Tornado Dragon Added one copy to the Deck for generic backrow removal since the Deck doesn't have much besides whatever is in the Side Deck at the time and Reactor Dragon. Consider running a AA-ZEUS instead as it'll probably be more useful (I'd run it if I owned it). Number 27: Dreadnought Dreadnoid One copy. Generic Rank 4 with some good protection and supports trains (despite it being a ship). If it ends up destroying something, you can overlay into Gustav Max for a phat 2k burn, or into Super Dora for a big beatstick/wall that can be rather annoying for the opponent to remove, and if you're really feeling it: overlay, overlay, overlay into a 4 or 5 material AA-ZEUS. Dingirsu, The Orcust of the Evening Star One copy, two if you're feeling it/find the room. Anchor Drill gave us access to Rank 7s and 8s and this is probably the best Rank 8 around. If you don't like it (and why wouldn't you) feel free to use something else like Number 11: Big Eye (target a Level 3 with Anchor Drill’s effect) or whatever. **Deep Breath** Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora What's with this ridiculously long name?? One copy. Personally, I prefer 2 Gustav Max and 1 Super Dora but you can swap the ratios if you want to, both works. This is for those times when Gustav Max is too vulnerable or you want to keep some of your monsters alive and effects their working. While good at both being a giant beatstick and gargantuan wall, he can also protect the vulnerable Chaos Giant if you plan on summoning it this turn. Detaching for the effect also triggers Derricrane or Bullet Train (the latter in the end-phase) making Super Dora a lot more appealing over Gustav sometimes. **Deeeeeep Breath** Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Juggernaut Liebe One copy, and another stupidly long name, but he makes up for that ridiculous name with its sheer FUCKING POWER, Liebe’s cannon isn't just for show. If you thought Chaos Giant was a beast, imagine Liebe as his more successful, cooler, sexier, and stronger cousin. Overlay this over Gustav Max or Super Dora after you've used either of their effects (or you if you haven't and want to attack more times). You can detach a material to have Liebe gain a permanent 2k ATK, bringing it up to 6000, then 8k the next turn (if it's still alive or you haven't already won). It can always attack a number of times on monster equal to its’ materials +1. That's 3 attacks, four if you didn't use Gustav's/Super Dora's effect. Use him to clear the board and if you haven't used Liebe's effect, let the rest of your monsters attack directly for fucking insane damage. This card is a powerhouse even by Machine standards, and does most of the work for the deck. Must include. Get one. They're cheap now too. Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Gustav Max Two copies. Some good, sweet burn damage that puts Dragoon to shame (Okay, that's a lie but Gustav at least looks 50x cooler- only if it's the LART we're talking about). I find myself going into this card a lot, burning my opponent, then either overlaying to Liebe or LINKing it off for Ballista or Knuckle. Gustav’s 2k burn on top of a Howitzer burn, and the awesome battle damage these machines can dish makes for ""EZ"" OTKs. Your opponent won't survive more than a few turns if they aren't careful. A Gustav burn and a direct attack from Liebe is exactly 8k damage. -- The 1 2 3s and ABCs (A.ncient B.eatsticks C.an S.mash) [Below was written with the original Deck in mind, it's still relevant and informative but it could be a bit better, but I'm not gonna rewrite all this. Use that big brain of yours to figure out where the new cards fit in] The main focus of the deck is to bring out Ancient Gear Ballista as fast as possible. The R10 XYZs are a nice addition and work well together with AG but they shouldn't be your main focus or win-con. Say your starting hand is AG Fusion, Urgent Schedule, AG Box, AG Wyvern, Droplet. You go second (this is a board-breaker deck after all) and draw Derricrane. A typical combo (for now I'm not going to factor in negates/disruption etc.) might look like this... Activate Schedule, Special Summon Machina Citadel and Pegasus. You already have Box and Wyvern; you don't need more AGs. Get whatever you want/lack into circulation. You Special Summoned an EARTH Machine. Special Summon from your hand Derricrane. Set Droplet, THEN Normal Summon Wyvern. Search Fortress and then activate it right away. XYZ Gustav Max using Citadel and Derricrane, detach Derricrane and burn your opponent for 2k. Derricrane's effect activates and pops a card. If you're going first, summon Super Dora instead, assuming you can Normal Summon and you have either Derricrane or Bullet Train in your hand. Or Foolish and Pegasus etc. Link Summon AG Ballista using Wyvern and Pegasus. If you don't have another monster to normal summon, use Gustav. Search Geartown, then activate Geartown and use Ballista's effect to pop it and make a monster your opponent controls ATK/DEF 0. If you didn't have Wyvern at this point, summon it off Geartown, otherwise summon Reactor Dragon. If you were going first ignore most of the above and just summon Bagooska. First turn you should prioritize getting as many fusion materials as you can and thinning out the deck as fast as possible, going second you can afford to be more aggressive and go for the beatsticks more. Use AG Fusion and summon AG Howitzer using Ballista and either the monster he searched for or one you had in your hand already/the Wyvern (don't use Reactor) you summoned off Geartown. Burn your opponent for 1k. You can then choose to Overlay Gustav into Liebe. If all you need is one solid hit, detach Citadel from Liebe and smack the 0/0'd monster that Ballista targeted for game, since Liebe is on 6k and you've burned for 3k so far. Otherwise if you don't detach it's just a solid 1k ATK upgrade over Gustav that can attack monsters three times! Plus all your other monsters can attack too if you didn't use Liebe's effect. So it's time for the fun part. The Battle Phase. Always attack with the Ancient Gears first since your opponent can't activate Spell and Traps (monster effects only if attacking with Wyvern, both if attacking with Reactor) until the end of the damage step. Use Reactor to pop either one of their backrow or another Geartown if you have one, don't always pop Fortress, it has good protection effects that are best left active, unless you need just one more hit. If you're lucky enough for there to be a monster greater than 1000ATK feel free to suicide Howitzer straight into that. That will summon another AG from the Deck, and the effect can't be negated if Fortress is up. If you have Citadel in the GY, he will special summon itself too since Howitzer is an EARTH Machine and it was just destroyed. If somehow your opponent survived your onslaught either through major disruption or magic bullshittery, go into MP2, you're not done. If you went into Leibe for the battle phase, detach Citadel now for Leibe's effect. Other monsters can't attack for the rest of the turn, but they weren't going to anyway. This puts Citadel in the GY giving you some protection. LINK Summon Knuckle using whatever's at hand, if you haven't used Bullet Train this turn, summon it now off Knuckle. For the most part, that's it you're done. If you went first you have a 4k defence wall that can make itself immune to card effects and if it has Derricrane as a material, it can also pop a card. Maybe a Howitzer or Bagooska too. If you went second you smashed your opponent so hard he didn't know what hit him. If you didn't already win you should soon. Assuming you weren't negated and disrupted at every corner, then your board will be much less impressive and your opponent won't be bleeding from every morsel. This summary assumes a lot, a real game is very different. If someone slaps down Barrier Statue of the Stormwinds or Lair of Darkness, you're fucked. Make sure to prepare an appropriate Side-Deck suited to your locals. I recommended at least 2 Twin-Twisters.   Tips and Little Tricks If you activated Schedule and have Pegasus in hand. Link away into Ballista before you summon Pegasus. That way Pegasus can target Ballista's materials in grave and Link into Knuckle or use it's other effect to XYZ into one of the Railway Cannons or the Dreadnought Dreadnoid. If you summoned Wyvern off a Geartown pop or a Howitzer float during your opponent's turn, search Ancient Gear Reborn (if you want to) since you can set it during your turn unlike normally when Wyvern locks you out from Setting cards for the rest of the turn, which doesn't matter during your opponent's turn. After Citadel has attacked you can nuke your opponent's monsters by tributing itself and attack directly with the rest of your monsters. Citadel can revive itself again next turn if your opponent destroys one of your monsters. If Ballista is destroyed on summon but his effect will still resolve, search out Box instead of Geartown, since Geartown is useless without Ballista. Box should search Anchor Drill and set you up for the next turn. Just because you know you're out of Reactor Dragons in the Deck, or any decent targets for a Howitzer float, doesn't mean your opponent knows that. Sitting on a bluffing Howitzer has worked for me sometimes. If Bullet Train summoned off Knuckle during your opponent's turn wasn't destroyed that turn, it still has its' effects negated during your turn. It can attack and you won't have to send 2 cards you control to the GY to do so. Anyway that's about it I guess. If I think of more things I'll add them later (and I never did lol).   *If you got the Anna "Kaboom" reference, I like you. We do use her trains after all.

deck_excerpt: A fun budget deck that can amount a lot of card advantage.
deck_description: When I first heard about the Prediction Princess deck I really wished that it was going to be playable pure. Sadly my wish did not come true. The deck is too slow and obviously, a deck centralized around flip monsters is usually going to be way too slow. But, if you use one of the only playable flip centralized deck in the entire game, Shaddoll, you can make a pretty formidable strategy. Basically what you want to do is open something that is to the degree of "Shaddoll Fusion" + "Pre-Preparation of Rites". First, you will want to activate (this an assuming that you are going second and your opponent controls an extra deck monster) "Shaddoll Fusion" sending "Shaddoll Beast" and "Performage Trick Clown" summoning "El Shaddoll Construct". Then as Chain Link 1 send "Reeshaddoll Wendi" with "El Shaddoll Construct". Then as Cain Link 2 draw a card with the effect of "Shaddoll Beast", lastly use the effect of "Performage Trick Clown" to Special Summon itself (if you didn't know, doing it in this exact order chain blocks your "El Shaddoll Construct's" effect). Finally, your "Reeshaaoll Wendi" effect will activate Special Summoning a "Shaddoll Beast" from your deck in Facedown Defence Position. Next, you will activate "Pre-Preparation of Rites" adding a "Prediction Princess Tarotrei" and a "Prediction Ritual" from your Deck to your hand. Then activating "Prediction Ritual" you can tribute your Facedown "Shaddoll Beast and your "Performage Trick Clown" to summon your "Prediction Princess Tarotrei". During your end phase "Prediction Princess Tarotrei" Special Summoning your "Shaddoll Beast" back to your side of the field facedown, then during your opponent"s turn "Prediction Princess Tarotrei" can flip it back face up to draw two cards!

deck_name: Thunder Dragon Chaos - Removed And Gain
deck_excerpt: Thunder dragon chaos a good deck that is based on removing send to the graveyard and gain an advantage come and see it for an analysis of the cards.
deck_description: This deck is based on the advantage that is gained by sending your Thunder Dragon Monsters to the graveyard or removing them, also Titan offers a great destruction to opponent cards in addition to being difficult to destroy. THUNDER DRAGONS Thunder Dragonduo: A chaos monster searchable by Dark. Thunder Dragonroar: You can discard it to recover resources but more importantly it can summon a Thunder Dragon from the Deck as Dark for search or Matrix for disruption. Thunder Dragonhawk: Revive if you discard it very necessary to continue some plays. Thunder Dragon: Provides bodies in GY for fusion in addition to that if you control Titan you can destroy several cards. Thunder Dragondark: If you send it it is a generic search for the archetype but if you do not plan to activate the effect you can add another for disruption or materials. Thunder Dragonmatrix: It gives attack but actually gives disruption, it also recycles if it is sent to the graveyard in case you lack one in hand. Thunder Dragon Fusion: Invoke using removed monsters or in very good GY since you will always have your monsters there but it can also be removed to search for a thunder monster which is very open and can help in recovery. Thunder Dragon Titan: Brutal asks for three materials but with kaminari only one destroys several times per turn and also protects himself several times. CHAOS Chaos Dragon Levianeer: It asks to remove 3 materials but in exchange it lets you gain 3 different effects depending on what you remove, the most common being to destroy 2 cards without targeting The Chaos Creator: Revive and recycle plus it's Thunder Collaserpent and Wyvernburster: They remove one to be summoned also they look for themselves they are very good since it is an advantage in any aspect. Chaos Space: Chaos search only for discards also recycles obviously is a good card Artifact It is a small engine that carries the deck but it serves to go first when invoking dagda and activating its set scyhte, on the opponent's turn you can destroy scythe with titan using matrix or dark thus leaving your rival without Extra Deck OTHER CARDS Aloof and Solar: These guys are good normal summons. Aloof allows you to remove two cards and send solar to the graveyard and earn a token. Allure of Darkness: You draw two and remove a dark will almost always be an advantage you can remove dark or roar and gain its effects. Instant Fusion and Kaminari: Summons Kaminari and with that an easier Titan. Gold Sarcophagus: You remove a Thunder Dragon from the deck to gain its effect. Predaplant Verte Anaconda: Allows you to activate fusion from the deck. OTHER OPTIONS Synchro Engine: Quickdraw is easily invoked discarding also if you use it together with a high-level thunder dragon you will win an ultimaya and with that if you set a card you can summon a Crystal Wing without restrictions. Dimension Shifter: It can make you gain resources since you don't lose anything if your cards are removed but your opponent is very likely to leave him in a bad situation. Artifacts: Moral lets destroy and Sactum invokes them for you practically for free.

deck_excerpt: Blind going 2nd hero deck that can end the game ASAP
deck_description:
OVERVIEW As we all know HERO is not always present when it comes to competitive scene, so I've tried various builds of it to fit in today's meta game. Fortunately I've found a build where it completely suits my playstyle which is an OTK with board wiping ability that has handtraps. It's consistency is a 10/10 to me when it comes to board wiping your opponent's field and it can dodge most of your opponent's targeting negeation since you have Vision HERO Increase, Mask Change, and Forbidden Droplet. Though in this build it's not a good idea to go 1st except when it's absolutely needed, the one condition of this HERO build when it goes 1st is that you need to have access to Mask Change or any handtraps in order to disrupt your opponent. The reason why i did not put Destiny HERO - Celestial and only put 2 Fusion Destiny is to decrease the chances of having a brick hand. Overall this deck is awesome to play especially when you know it's in and outs and how you expect what cards your opponent will negate.   HANDTRAPS EXPLANATION
  • Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring - A standard handtrap since it's usable against any deck.
  • Droll & Lock Bird - Since Maxx C is banned here in  TCG, I've noticed that most combo decks are not afraid to continue their combo and most of them will not be stopped by 1 or 2 handtraps. So I've decided to use a handtrap that impacts them in a whole turn.
  • Infinite Impermanence - A pretty handy handtrap since it you can use this on either player's turn considering you control no cards on the field.
  SIDE DECK EXPLANATION
  • Dinowrestler Pankratops - A free body card and can pop  your opponent's card. Good card to use if you want to bait your opponent's negate.
  • Artifact Lancea - A handy card to use against banish type deck.
  • Ghost Ogre & Snow Rabbit - Since Numeron is still a thing in TCG, this card is a must.
  • Mask Change - The single mask change that's in the side deck because this build is blind going 2nd. Side this in if you are planning to go 1st.
  • Twin Twisters - A must have card against backrow decks. I was not planning to put this card if Pankratops is not limited.
  • Prohibition - Since Crossout Designator is not available in TCG, this card is a must have if you don't want to get Nibiru'd
  • Summon Limit - A substitute for Vanity's Emptiness since it's banned in TCG.
  • Anti-Spell Fragrance - Kinda like Imperial Order so i put 2 of  it.
  • Imperial Order - Self explanatory card.
  • Red Reboot - Another self explanatory card
  REMINDERS
  • Always keep in mind to bait your opponent's negation/disruption.
  • As much as possible you want to activate another card before chaining Forbidden Droplet, so you can send that card on the field to the GY. That way you can save some resources.
  • As much as possible avoid using a monster handtrap if you're oppoent doesn't have a monster on the field, you might get baited so that they can use PSY-Framegear Gamma.

deck_excerpt: A more consistent build of Invoked Dogmatika with a twist
deck_description:
OVERVIEW Since the debut of Dogmatika archetype in TCG, it's been one of the most used engine. The most famous deck of this archetype is the Invoked Dogmatika, just by reading you know what the deck would look like so I've made a little bit of tweaking. I did not put a shaddoll engine here since it's gonna be inconsistent, so I've added cards that will cover up the deck's weak point. By adding more draw power, disruption , and board break cards I've been able to add more consistency to it and increase it's board breaking ability. The major problem of this deck is that if you do not have access to aleister or nadir/ecclesia, it'll be a hard game for you, luckily with the help of the handtraps, trap cards, and draw cards the probability of it happening will be lower, even if it happens you will have time to gather resources since your traps will buy you time.   UNIQUE CARDS EXPLANATION
  • Dinowrestler Pankratops - Since you will not always be the one winning the decision on who will go 1st, I've put this in the main deck just in case. A material for the earth Invoked.
  • Mind Control - Same reason with Pankratops.
  • Spellbook of Knowledge - A fallback option in case your monster's effect is negated, since most of your monsters are spellcasters.
  SIDE DECK EXPLANATION
  • Nibiru, The Primal Being - Good for board breaking especially against opponent that does not have a bait or negation.
  • Artifact Lancea - To avoid being countered by retaliating c.
  • Dark Ruler No More - Just in case your handtraps did not do the work, use this card.
  • Mystic Mine - A good card to slow the pace of the game, which is favorable to this deck.
  • Evenly Matched - Self explanatory card. A good card to use with dark ruler no more.
  • Summon Limit - In the case that your opponent isn't that much affected by crackdown, use this instead
  REMINDERS
  • Always keep an eye on your resources, do not rush to end the game.
  • Side out cards that will be not use that much: For example side out dogmatika punishment, crackdown, feather duster, and cosmic cyclone against infernoble knight, side in nibiru, dark ruler no more, and evenly matched.
  • Don't forget the effect of the extra deck monster that you will send to the GY.
  • Do not forget the side effect of using Dogmatika Punishmenth, which is you cannot special summon a monster from the extra deck until the end of your next turn.

deck_excerpt: Blind going 2nd HERO deck that will end the game in a blink of an eye
deck_description:
OVERVIEW So I've decided to cut some cards on this HERO build and add infinite impermanence to adjust in the meta game. The reason for that is because of thunder dragon, just by putting thunder dragon colossus in the field will be a nightmare for HERO users. I removed Destiny HERO - Celestial and Triple Tactics Talent, the reason for that it's because most of the time i can't use their effect. I've also cut Fusion Destiny to 2 since I removed Celestial, I can now only use 1 Fusion Destiny once per game due to the lack of material. With those adjustments, my HERO deck will now be more consistent and will have an additional negation. I've also made some changes in the side deck since some of the previous cards in it are not as effective as I have imagined.   SIDE DECK EXPLANATION
  • Nibiru, The Primal Being - I only run 1 copy of it since it's just a target for Crossout Designator.
  • Dinowrestler Pankratops - A handy card to pop one of my opponent's card .
  • Artifact Lancea - Good against deck that needs to banish cards. Decks like Thunder Dragon, Phantom Knights, etc.
  • Droll & Lock Bird - If you think ash blossom is not enough to stop your opponent's combo, use this card instead.
  • Mask Change - The last mask change is in the side deck because this build is for blind going 2nd. I know mask change is a good card but it can be a brick if I run 3 copies of it in the main deck while my goal is to break my opponent's board.
  • Crossout Designator - I was wrong about this card, this card is my savior against Nibiru, Maxx C, etc.
  • Vanity's Emptiness - A self explanatory card.
  • Anti-Spell Fragrance - It's like a nerfed Imperial Order.
  • Imperial Order - Another self explanatory card.
  • Red Reboot - Once again a self explanatory card.
  REMINDERS
  • Even if your opponent's end board going 1st will have multiple negates/disruption, don't be afraid to still go 2nd because this deck has more cards of break boarding compared and handtraps compared to it's control cards.
  • Always use a card effect first before chaining Forbidden Droplet, it will help you save resources since you can send the activated card on the field to the GY and it will still resolve normally.
  • Always think of the possible situation if your opponent negates a certain card that you'll use, think of a fallback option so that you will still put on a board.
  • If you think your opponent runs PSY-Framegear Gamma in their main deck, as much as possible don't use a monster handtrap when they don't control a monster since you'll just get baited.

deck_excerpt: OTK based variant of Thunder Dragon
deck_description: Deck Style: OTK, Combo  Main Attribute, Type: Light/Dark, Thunder  The main strategy of the deck is to go second and utilize your myriad of board wiping effects, such as Lightning Storm and Thunder Dragon Titan, to clear the way for your high attack monsters to OTK. The deck features a number of relatively easy to summon monsters in order to swarm the field for massive damage potential. When forced to go first, the deck provides protection in the forms of Denko Sekka, Thunder Dragon Thunderstormech, and Thunder Dragonlord.  3 Lightning Storm and 3 Pot of Desires can be swapped out for other cards if needed (other handtraps or Kaijus are good alternatives).

deck_excerpt: Yokai of Japan meet El Hombre Dorado from Colombia, and they get along well.
deck_description: This definitely isn't the most powerful version of Eldlich, but it may be one of the best ways to play Mayakashi besides the Bone Tower FTK. the synergy between the two archetypes is fun, and it gives Mayakashi some appreciated disruption.  The Mayakashi engine is pretty straightforward, you want to use Hajun to summon Dakki and begin Synchro climbing to Gashadokuro, with Yuki Musume as an extender that can either start another ladder, or preferably help make the powerful Link 4 Yuki-Onna the Absolute Zero Mayakashi. She can make the ATK of a monster 0 and negate it's effects when a monster is summoned from, or an effect is activated in the GY up to twice per turn.  As for Eldlich, he provides a notorious advantage engine over the course of interrupting your opponent with soldiers of the Golden Land and summoning himself or other Zombies with the Eldlixirs, all of which float in the GY.  Cards such as Yuki-Musume can help get Golden Lord to the GY so you can SS him by his own effect. And the Scarlet and White Eldlixirs can revive any Zombie from the GY while Golden Lord is on the field, allowing you to summon your Mayakashi Synchros from the GY proactively to pop stuff, instead of waiting for your opponent to destroy the current one on the board.  The two archetypes are pretty easy to grasp on their own, and do not get in each others way. So I thought I would make a quick profile on it. I'm not a master of either of these two themes, so feel free to correct any misunderstanding I might have in the comments, or ask any other questions.

deck_excerpt: Unchained (blind 2nd)
deck_description:
He there! Welcome to my take on Unchained. Below I've laid out my deck list choices, I hope they inspire you in your take on the deck. Please leave a comment if you like my choices or have any suggestions for improvements :). Cheers from the Netherlands I will discuss the following 3 bullet points:
  • Why blind 2nd?
  • Card choices
  • Main combo/opening hands
  • Final comment on outing Dragoon
Why blind 2nd? I dont think there is much debate here. I have played going 1st and 2nd versions a lot. What ends up happening is that your line of play is pretty much the same either way, but in a going 2nd strategy you can use your opponents monsters as link material instead of ending on a mediocre board with 1 - 3 interruptions. Card choices
  • 3x all of the Unchained monsters. Pretty standard. Optionally you can play 2x Sarama, this decreases consistency and grind game but increases the ceiling of the deck.
  • 2x Abominable and 1x Soul of disaster. Pretty standard too. I would love to play 2x Soul of disaster but its too much of a brick imo.
  • 3x Ash blossom. Most generic hand trap in game.
  • 3x gamma + driver. This hand trap is NUTS. Not just in general, but specifically in this deck. You play 3x Extrav, 3x Aruha and 3x Rota which all activate in your hand with no monsters on the field (get the hint already???). Also, you often end up with no monsters on the field due to ramming your monsters into your opponents with the goal of triggering their effects in battle phase (giving you an empty board).
  • 2x DD Crow. This is really up to you and nr 1 card choice you can/should change. Its just that DD Crow is a personal favourite of mine, with banishing not just monsters and being a quick effect it really provides a unique game mechanic (e.g. hit Miscellaneousaurus from Dinos).
  • 1x Pankratops. Hands down this card gets banned next banlist (works really well with evenly matched I must point out).
  • 3x rota.
  • 3x Extravagance.
  • 1x Harpie feather duster.
  • 2x Dark ruler no more. Amazing in this deck under the right circumstances. You could play 3 but I think its too much with 3x Extravagance.
  • 3x of both Unchained traps.
  • 3x Evenly matched. I can not express how much I love this card. Especially in Unchained too, since skipping battle phase does pretty much nothing (you will OTK in only 1/10 games, mostly you will do 3x 1500 + 300 damage anyway).
Card choices (extra deck)
  • 3x Unchained link 2, 3
  • 2x Unchained Abomination
  • 2x Knightmare unicorn (going into unicorn on opponents turn is gold!)
  • Topologic zeroboros and Bomber dragon are both nice options to keep the interruptions interactive on opps turn (bomber dragon for Salamangreat/Crusadia e.g.,  Zeroboros for any deck that can Soul charge/spam tokens)
  • Framelord omega
  • Pegasus @Ignister is INSANE against Dogmatika. The synergy with this deck is unreal
  • Dingirsu for non targeting and non destructive removal. Be careful with the fiend lock in this deck ofc.
Card choices (side)
  • DD Crow, as I said personal favourite.
  • Artifact package. You can pop your own Scythe if you have too
  • Cosmic cyclone and Heavy storm duster for instant win against backrow.
  • Imperial order and Skill drain are free Ws. Especially skill drain is must for this deck, having all your Unchained monsters activate in GY.
  • 3x Lancea because Dino matchup is really bad. Like really hah.
Main combo/opening hands
  • As I said earlier, Gamma + 1 of (rota, Extrav, Aruha) is on itself full combo. Make sure to use the Gamma to go into Omega for the +1 ;).
  • Dark ruler + any Unchained monster is full break a board. Activate Dark ruler, ram monster and bring either Abominable or Soul of disaster to the field and go on from there.
  • Evenly matched. Activate evenly matched, if it resolves you win, if it doesnt, do the standard Aruha/Rakea + trap combo.
Final comment on outing dragoon
  • Under the right circumstances, facing a Dragoon can be an instant scoop. Know how to deal with this card. Best is to go straight to battle phase, ram Unchained monster, and bring out Abominable to ram into the dragoon. If your monster eff in GY gets negated by dragoon that is actually pretty good, because it does not gain the +1k Atk stat. Also, activating Rakea on field instead of Aruha in hand is also encouraged if you must because Aruha does not trigger when destroyed from hand.

deck_excerpt: No Linkross, Jet, or O-Lion shenanigan. VFD with only Baking+Plaguespreader in GY, means Uni-Zombie/Shiranui Solitaire is game. Combo gives draw 2 and
deck_description: Meme. No lol, this is serious. Combo tutorial: https://bit.ly/3lWdZ8n Endboard is VFD with Chaos Ruler (can Borreload Savage too, but it lacks follow-up) and since our goal is to send Baking and Plaguespreader to GY, Uni-Zombie/Shiranui Solitaire are the best starter. To complement that we use Foolish Burial, One for One, and Tuner's High. We don't use Allure of Darkness as we need our Skull Servants in GY, Tuner's High kinda replace its role tho. King of the Skull Servants act as follow-up, 3 copies for easier search via Chaos Ruler or 2 draws from our combo, Monster Reborn works good too since we will have 1 King in GY (and 4 Skull Servants, means 4k via Monster Reborn, 5k if it's not) while being great extender. Chaos Ruler also can re-summon itself while dumping more Skull Servant and/or Plaguspreader, making our follow-up play legit. The rest are just staples, better with dark/light attribute (Nibiru and Veiler) as Chaos Ruler target for extra interruption. Pros: Legit board with follow-up and staples. Cons: Skull Servant theme is brick city.

deck_excerpt: Dragonmaids with an Invoked engine
deck_description: Haven't made a deck in a hot minute, but here we go again. Plus sides to getting  high as all hell? Fuel to making bad yu-gi-oh decks. My personal drug addiction aside, we have a new deck here; Dragonmaids with a Invoked engine. I adore Dragonmaids, but personally, I found that they're not super powerful on their own. To supplement this, I included a Invoked engine, which is great for spamming out multiple fusions to help the Dragonmaids. It also mashes quite well with the Dragonmaids, as the Dragonmaids have an array of attributes. Now, onto the guide. You'll want to get a low level Dragonmaid out to activate their effect, whether it be searching or sending a card to the GY. Your goal should be to turbo out House as fast as possible, then use the engine pieces for Invoked to get out whatever you can, based off of what's on hand. Then go into the battle phase, and bounce the low level Dragonmaids back to the hand for stronger ones from the hand or GY. Deck list explanation. We have the core dragonmaid cards, with the usual shit. For the humanoid forms, 3 kitchen, 3 chamber, 3 parlor, and 1 nurse. Kitchen is great for searching cards, Chamber is great for searching the fusion spell, Chamber is great for GY set up, and Nurse is good for late game revival to go into combos. We also have all of their dragon forms, which can be used to go into during the battle phase.  We have their fusion spell, to get out House as fast as possible, Send-off to special out monsters, Tidying for removal, and the other trap I forget the name of for searching. We also have House in the extra deck, and then Sheou, House's dragon form. You'll want to get out House, use her for a little bit to get off her effects for removal, and then fuse into Sheou. Invoked Engine The invoked engine carries 3 Aleister as a main core of it, for fusion material, Invokation is their fusion spell, and Magical Meltdown for searching Aleister. In the extra deck, we have lots of their fusion monsters, all of which are choices you can make based off of the attributes you have on hand and the attributes you have. As always, any suggestion or advice is appreciated. Have a good day. (Also, i know y'all prob don't care, but I got a GF! It's housewife time)

deck_name: Dark Warrior Phantom Knight Meklord Orcust
deck_excerpt: Dark Warrrior Synchro Turbo Phantom Knight Meklord Orcust Combo Deck (Going First)
deck_description: Alright guys so after testing this deck idea I had this idea of combining all these different archetypes, I realized they all work out when mashed together. This deck always wants to go first so you can full combo and prevent them from playing. I didn't feel like doing a combo tutorial on this deck because I didn't think it was necessary. You should by now know the synchro, orcust, and phantom knights combo as its nothing new. The deck is just full of extenders and really pushes the Orcust, Phantom Knights and Dark Warrior engines to their fullest potential. In my experience, the deck doesn't brick very much and is pretty consistent. I will explain the small combos here you may not already know exist within the deck. The basic Orcust and Synchro combo are in here for more draw power and getting out Apollousa. There are extenders like Chaos Space for the baby dragons and discarding the Orcust pieces. The Meklord combo is easy. Use Meklord Nucleus Infinity Core's effect to search out Meklord Assembly and then use Meklord Assembly to search out Meklord Emperor Wisel - Synchro Absorption and use Meklord Assembly's second effect to discard an Orcust monster or whatever you to want to discard that will benefit you and destroy Nucleus to bring out Meklord Emperor Wisel then you can go full synchro combo if you had an extender like Adhara or the baby dragons. Then after all that, going into Apollousa, you should do full Orcust combo and then Phantom Knight combo to get one Fog Blade and the Phantom Knight rank up magic spell. You must have Dingrisu in grave to do the rank up magic combo. During their main phase use Cymbal Skeleton in grave to summon Ding but dont use dings effect unless its to send a card from field to grave. Then use rank up magic to go into True King of all Calamities. I suppose if someone comments down below for a combo tutorial I will do it and upload the replay to mediafire for you guys. But most combos here aren't anything new except the Meklord one I came up with that is an extended play. Using Barricadeborg Blocker to discard an Orcust monster for full Orcust combo is also another great play we all love lol. Another small tip you may not realize is using Adhara plus another monster you can go into Haqlifibrax and summon Brass Bombard which is full Orcust combo, especially if you have another Orcust monster to special summon off Bombard's graveyard effect. As always, I hope you guys enjoy the deck profile and stay tuned for more awesome custom deck profiles made by me!

deck_excerpt: Fusion summon and equip with Invoked Magistus! Hope you enjoy!
deck_description: Invoked and Magistus are two decks I think that they synergize quite well together making for some interesting plays. The deck focuses more on hitting your opponent when time arises, or by making some power plays. Magistus is a interesting archetype that equips Magistus monsters from the extra deck to themselves for effects, which I found to be a pretty neat idea! Here is a quick explanation of each of the Magistus bosses: Vafram can destroy your all of your opponent's face up cards when he is destroyed, if he is equipped to a monster the equipped monster cannot be destroyed by spells and traps. Ninaruru can destroy a s/t your opponent controls as long as you destroy a Magistus card in your own s/t zone, and when she is equipped to a monster, it can attack twice. Finally, we have Saint Aiwass who can (target) a monster on the field during either players main phase and equip himself to the selected monster. If you equipped him to an opponents monster, you take control of it. Although it will not be able to activate it's effects, the equipped monster gains a nice 1000 atk/def boost.  Have fun playing Invoked Magistus!  ^-^

deck_excerpt: A very flexible deck that has a lot of potential depending on the user. Kryptonite against decks that relies heavily on extra deck.
deck_description:
OVERVIEW I've been brainstorming on how to improve Nekroz's consistency and efficiency since unicore has been of the banlist. Sadly since we're in an era where handtrap is most likely in a deck, adjusting the deck became much more challenging to the point where it's consistency decreases and it's endboard is not that worth due to it's consistency. But the Dogmatika Archetype made Nekroz's life much easier: increasing their consistency, disruption, board breaking, and it's sustainability against extra deck reliant decks. These two archetypes are like kryptonite against decks that relies on their extra deck a lot: with nekroz having unicore who is a skill drain against monsters that are summoned from the extra deck and of course there is brionac who is a multipurpose card, it can be used to search a Nekroz monster or  you can ritual summon it to bounce 2 extra deck monsters, and lastly the Dogmatika monsters, ecclesia provides a sustain since she can't be destroyed by battle against extra deck monsters, and the best monster in the Dogmatika when using it with nekroz is Maximus, he can dump Herald of the Arc Light and Titaniklad/Wind Pegasus/N'tss/Skull Knight which will result in a huge advantage for the user since you can search for a ritual monster/spell and still have a negation/destroy. Overall I'm quite satisfied with this build since it can compete with meta decks, though do note that in order to utilize this deck's full potential you need to analyze your opponent's deck and in and outs of this deck, since this deck is only as good as it's user.   2 CARD COMBO (BRIONAC + ANY IMPCANTATION MONSTER BESIDES TALISMANDRA AND CHALISLIME) Take note that you don't need to specifically draw these two cards in your opening hand in order to perform this combo. The main goal of this is to have access to Cyber Angel Benten be used in a Ritual Summon in order to search for Vanity's Ruler, while having two monsters on the field without having use your normal summon, so that you can tribute Summon Vanity's Ruler
  • Use the Impcantation monster's effect two special summon Impcantation Talismandra, use Talismandra's effect in order to search for Cyber Angel Benten.
  • Use Brionac's effect to search for Clausolas, then use it's effect to search for Nekroz Cycle.
  • Use Nekroz Cycle to special summon Brionac from the GY, tributing Cyber Angel Benten. Use Benten's effect to search for Vanity's Ruler.
  • Tribute summon Vanity's Ruler using the two Impcantation monsters.
  EXTRA DECKS MONSTERS EXPLANATION
  • Elder Entity N'tss - It's a standard card to run for Nekroz and Dogmatika since these two archetypes sends a lot of extra deck monsters to GY to function.
  • PSY-Framelord Omega - Good for recycling your extra deck monster in the GY. This can also be used to remove a card from your opponent's GY.
  • Wind Pegasus @Ignister - A good card to be in the GY since it will make your opponent think twice to destroy your monsters because this can send their monster back to the deck/extra deck if they do so.
  • Daigusto Emeral - Good in the grind game, though you will not use this most of your games.
  • Nephthys, The Sacred Flame - If your opponent's deck have trouble against a monster that has a high attack, cannot be destroyed by battle and card effect, and cannot be targeted by card effects, the this dude is your saviour.
  • Eria the Water Charmer, Gentle - Same reason as Daigusto Emeral.
  SIDE DECK CARDS EXPLANATION So most cards in this are for going 2nd since the main deck is not that great for breaking boards.
  • Artifact Lancea - Good to side against decks that needs to banish cards. You can also use this to avoid macro cosmos, D.D. Crow, Dimension Shifter, etc.
  • Droll & Lock Bird - Since this deck cannot run handtraps like Ash Blossom and Infinite Impermanence, using a handtrap that has a lingering effect will be wiser since it will greatly limit your opponent's options. Droll is really good at today's meta in TCG since Called By The Grave is limited and there is not Crossout Designator. Also most combo decks now doesn't care if they got handtraps like 1-2 times since they can still put a decent board.
  • Starving Venom Fusion Dragon - Super Poly target 1.
  • Mudragon of the Swamp - Super Poly target 2.
  • Dark Ruler No More - Good to side against a going 1st combo deck, this card paired with evenly matched is a nightmare for them.
  • Cosmic Cyclone - Good against backrow decks. I use 2 of this instead 2 of twin twisters since this deck needs many resources as much as possible.
  • Twin Twisters - I only use this if my opponent's backrow is so annoying.
  • Super Polymerization - Self explanatory card.
  • Evenly Matched - Board breaker. Pair this with Dark Ruler No More and your opponent will be cryin'.
REMINDERS
  • Don't forget about the Nekroz's ritual spells effect in the GY.
  • Trishula's effect needs to banish exactly 3 cards from hand, field, and GY.
  • Be wise what to dump from the extra deck.
  • This deck is only as good as it's user.

deck_excerpt: Block the opponent's attacks. banish all cards from the game and summon monsters with enormous attack power. With the power of Helios and Homunculus,
deck_description:
The main goals of this deck is to field the cards Gravekeeper's Servant and Macro Cosmos/Banisher of the Radiance/ Banisher of the Light/ Dimensional Fissure to prevent the opponent from attacking. In this way the opponent, no matter how powerful monsters he has, It will not be able to attack you as long as the two-card combo is active.   You will then need to use the rest of the cards and especially the combo Gold Sarcophagus + Necroface to remove as many cards from the game as possible, in this way, once a Helios/Golden Homunculus card is evoked, their attack will be so high that they can wipe out any monster of the opponent. Useful combos:
  • D.D Survivor can be used to evoke Helios/Homunculus, once removed from the field it can return at the end of the turn and can be useful in case you have no more monsters in the field.
  • Chaos Zone + Necroface + (Soul Release) is very convenient in case many monsters have been removed from the game, in this case it is ensured that once per turn any monster can be resummoned.
  • The Cheerful Coffin, Monster Gate and Dimensional Alchemist are very useful in combination with Soul Release to increase the attack of Helios or to have monsters removed from the deck, so they can be re-enacted via Chaos Zone or d.d.r Different Dimension Reincarnation
  • Soul Absorption and Graverobber's Retribution are used to heal the LP and respectively to inflict constant damage to the opponent's LP.
